We will also hire interns to work remotely from other cities (but for other roles, not bookkeeping). What skills and experience are you looking for? This posting is for a bookkeeping intern. We also seek interns with a wide range of skills: graphic designers, videographers, writers, researchers, creative thinkers, analytical sorts, community organizers, social media stars, people with great communication skills, MBA students, and more. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from everyone. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your resumé, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. When will you select the interns? We’re agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won’t keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are hiring for the fall semester, for the summer, and beyond. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer, and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send an impressive cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org.
10001.title: Bookkeeping Internship with ClassWish.org.  Make a Difference! Internship in NYC

10001.description: We are recruiting outstanding high school, undergraduate and graduate students as interns for the last summer 2012-2013 school year and beyond to collaborate on the boldest nonprofit initiative we know. We are looking for passionate, energetic students with exceptional skills to take initiative on a range of projects. This is an outstanding leadership opportunity in an innovative start-up nonprofit organization. Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Books, computers, art supplies, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish.org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as Adam Hirsch, former COO, Mashable; Laurie Coots, CMO, TBWA; Scott Cutler, EVP, New York Stock Exchange; Betsy Morgan, former CEO, Huffington Post; Nancy Pelz-Paget, Director, Education and Society Program, Aspen Institute; Sharon Robinson, CEO, American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Forbes Magazine liked our approach so much that they donated a full page to help raise awareness. Yo-Yo Ma, Tony Hawk and Dwight Howard are among the celebrities who have offered to help promote ClassWish.org. The work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to raise greater awareness and encourage more participation so we can help more kids. Interns will work in small teams focused on such things as: marketing to particular audiences, such as businesses, bloggers, press, educators, moms, religious organizations, civic organizations, unions, nonprofits, authors, soap operas, magazine readers, teens and celebrities marketing around particular school subjects, such as science, music, art, reading and sports marketing around particular promotions (such as http://ClassWish.org/days and http://ClassWish.org/books/124) creating and implementing social media campaigns building and managing relationships with strategic partners such as http://EdRover.com building and leading a national network of volunteers enhancing the website creating graphics and promotional materials You will take leadership on projects and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. What do we offer? You will enhance your resume with a solid record of professional achievement and community service, and you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. If you want a great experience doing something you will always be proud of, send a cover letter and a resume to interns@ClassWish.org. Impress us. This is competitive. FAQ Is this a business or a nonprofit? ClassWish is a nonprofit, but we use the latest techniques from the business world to make a leveraged, scalable and financially-self sustaining difference in the lives of tens of millions of children. This sounds ambitious! Daniel Burnham, the great Chicago architect, said \"Make no little plans; they have not the power to stir men's souls.\" (Nor women's, we hasten to add). Little plans also do not have the power to provide a better education to 56 million kids who deserve more than they are getting today. We face a crushing need in schools, have a solid plan to address it, and with your help, we intend to grow this very large and very fast. Where are you located? We are in Manhattan, conveniently located right across from Madison Square Garden. We will also hire interns to work remotely from other cities. What skills and experience are you looking for? We seek a wide range of skills: graphic designers, videographers, writers, researchers, creative thinkers, analytical sorts, community organizers, social media stars, people with great communication skills, MBA students, and more. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from everyone. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your resumé, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. When will you select the interns? We're agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won't keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are hiring for the summer, for the fall semester, and beyond. Tell us what you are looking for. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer, and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send an impressive cover letter and a resume to interns@ClassWish.org.
10001.title: Help Children Get A Better Education: Intern at Classwish! Work in NYC or Virtually

10001.description: Our Hotline program is GMHC’s oldest volunteer opportunity and provides support and information to callers in need of someone to talk to. Volunteers with the Hotline have the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of callers while also learning a wealth of information regarding HIV/AIDS, counseling methods, and more. Hotline Counselors provide information and referral services regarding HIV/AIDS and GMHC's programs and services to the general public who contact the GMHC Hotline by phone and email. Volunteers need to be able to respond to a diverse group of callers with diverse needs, and to stay informed about latest HIV/AIDS developments as well as GMHC policies and protocols. Bilingual Spanish/English is a plus. There is a critical need for daytime, weekday availability (Monday 2 - 6 pm, Wednesday10 am - 2 pm, and Friday 2 - 6 pm.) Calls and emails to the GMHC Hotline could include topics such as: Concerns about HIV and AIDS Questions about HIV transmission and prevention Referrals to HIV/STI testing Connection to care Information about GMHC services How to become a GMHC client Training will be provided by GMHC staff members and includes a 3-day intensive training, a series of Practicum sessions, and a listening-in period where trainees shadow senior Hotline Counselors to gain a real understanding of the work. Training is offered twice a year in the spring and in the fall. Due to the extensive training involved, we require a minimum one-year commitment from all Hotline Counselors.
10001.title: Hotline Counselor

10001.description: Join our Volunteer team and make a meaningful contribution to our community by using your talents to support the award-winning programs at The Actors Theatre Workshop. The Actors Theatre Workshop is an award-winning non-profit theater, educational institution and community center in NYC founded by award-winning actor, director, writer and producer, Thurman E. Scott, an acclaimed master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. We are currently seeking a Salesforce.com Developer for our Salesforce application. The Developer will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, testing, implementation and support of our Saleforce.com application. The Developer should possess knowledge of Saleforce.com platform architecture, relational databases, and experience with creating custom Apex and Visualforce code to enhance the Salesforce.com application. Responsibilities: - Facilitate meetings with key users and define / specify CRM requirements and customizations according to ATW needs. - Develop functional requirements and deliver CRM solutions according to ATW requirements. - Complete migration of contacts and data from current web-based CRM application to Salesforce. - Remain up-to-date and knowledgeable on Salesforce resources, best practices, tools and technologies in order to leverage the latest and best of Salesforce at ATW. Qualifications: - Experience with Salesforce OR experience with relational databases and SQL is required. - Experience with Apex and Visualforce is recommended. - Excellent verbal and written communication skills. - Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems or related field is preferred. - A passion and interest in Salesforce. - An openness to ideas and a curiosity to learn new things is required. The community we serve will be tremendously thankful for your service. To find out more about our organization, please RSVP to attend our next info session, RSVP! for our Volunteer Information and Interview Session! Go to our website http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com; click on \"Volunteer Program\" to fill out our online application and we will set up an Information and Interview Session for you! IMPORTANT: In response to the overwhelming number of applicants who wish to be considered for the upcoming program, the Info Session will also include an Application and Interview Session. We will extend the Information Session until everyone has completed their interview. Please plan ample time to complete this process. Join our Volunteer Leadership team and make a meaningful contribution to our community through using your managerial talents and leading teams to support the award-winning programs at The Actors Theatre Workshop.

10001.description: Find out how you can grow creatively as a Video Volunteer at an award-winning non-profit theater that serves our community! RSVP for our Information Session for Video Professionals! (See RSVP details below!) Our goal is to put together a volunteer team that can edit the groundbreaking work being done at The Actors Theatre Workshop. Using your professional skills to edit this wonderful material will surely stimulate hope, excitement and I believe bring true enlightenment to those who participate. At the same time you will reach another dimension in your craft as you learn about the unique filming/editing perspective of the ATW Founder and Artistic Director, Thurman E. Scott. ATW has long been on the front lines of disciplined creative training for theater professionals and individuals committed to fulfilling their creative potential. ATW has also been a safe haven for thousands of at-risk and homeless youth. The original theater and educational technique which has been tremendously successful with our professional acting students, has proven to be equally beneficial to the children we teach in our after-school programs. We have many years of footage from our adult acting workshop's and community program's that we want to share with you and the world. We've started sharing this video online and we've received such positive feedback from every corner of the globe that we are taking steps to put out more. This process takes time and so we would like to find more dedicated individuals who want to learn and make a difference in other people's lives and be a part of something hopeful by joining our video editing team. Our editors often talk about the beautiful, inspiring and deeply moving moments they have witnessed when a student actor or a child from a homeless shelter brings forth his talent and reaches for their potential. You literally see the moments when there is a shift in consciousness and they begin to accept their strength and the unique gifts that they have to offer the world. And in that moment you know that this person has changed forever-- and as a result undoubtedly so have you. By working directly with this material you will gain deep insight into the emotional and psychological breakdown of drama, and learn to see the penetrating insights that come out of script analysis, which gives you the ability to find and understand the eternal essence of ideas that are then formulated into a universal idea that helps to instill faith and spread hope to all individuals on a creative journey. So without further ado.. We invite you to a Volunteer Info Session for video editing professionals .To RSVP go to: http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com, click on \"volunteers\" and fill out an online application. We will contact you to set up an Information and Interview Session. At the Info Session you'll have a chance to meet leaders in the organization, learn about the work ATW has done in the community and see some of the inspiring videos that have already been cut. Thank you! For more information go to http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com or contact us at outreach@actorstheatreworkshop.com or call 212-947-1386 x0. ATW is located at 145 W. 28th Street, New York NY.

10001.description: Non-Profit Management/Video Internship for Award-Winning Non-Profit Theater Conservatory in NYC! This is an intensive Leadership Training Program in non-profit business management. Interns receive hands-on training as a management assistant. If skilled in video, interns may assist in video production and editing at our award-winning theater arts and community service organization. As video production becomes increasingly critical to the growth, development and success of managing a successful non-profit, we seek intern candidates that are leaders who are passionate about non-profit management and posses skills in video production and editing. Successful non-profits are built on powerful ideas that inspire hope. These ideas are manifested in the programs and the management of the organization. By gaining a working understanding of how to successfully manage a nonprofit organization, the intern begins to learn its core principals, which allows the intern to begin to take a leadership role in the organization. In addition, this knowledge is invaluable in the creation of videos that effectively promote and bring this work to the world. These videos are essential to the marketing and fund-raising efforts in any successful non-profit. We are looking for individuals with the ability to lead, manage teams, work independently, communicate effectively on the phone, in person and in writing and interact in a fast-paced business environment. We are looking for idealists and leaders who can put their thoughts and insights into action; positive, enthusiastic individuals who want to make a difference in the world and are committed to upholding the legacy and tradition of theater in the belief that theater can change a life and make the world a better place for everyone. The interns' primary responsibility is to manage the daily administrative operations of the organization and to take a leadership role in programming initiatives. There will be opportunities to work closely with the senior staff: in administrating over workshops for actors and community programs that serve Youth-at-Risk and homeless children. Under ATW supervision, interns will be accountable for projects in the management of ATW's studio rental business, administration, team management, marketing, development, sales, fund-raising, video production, event planning, and graphic design. For international applicants, English proficiency is required. In addition, Interns may also work on a combination of logging, editing, and production of on-going video projects that depend on ATW's current schedule and on the intern's skill level. Interns will work under the direction of a project manager. We seek applicants with training and experience logging footage, editing in Final Cut Pro, http streaming, digital shooting, lighting, sound and web design and development. Interns and Volunteers consistently report they gain tremendously from filming and reviewing footage of ATW classes and workshops and have benefited as if they had actually taken the classes themselves. In summary, we seek professional, detail-oriented individuals who are positive and curious, with a desire to learn and engage in a process. The Actors Theatre Workshop is an award-winning non-profit theater, educational institution and community center in NYC founded by award-winning actor, director, writer and producer, Thurman E. Scott, an acclaimed master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. Stella Adler declared, \" Thurman E. Scott is the inheritor of the Stanislavsky legacy and of my legacy. His work advances acting technique for the next generation.\" Internships are available for 4 to 18 months in duration and are 40 hrs per week. This is a non-paid training program. Application instructions: To be considered, candidates must complete an application online, followed by interviews. For more information and to complete an application go to: http://www.ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com and click on Internships. For questions, email us at Outreach@ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com or call 212.947.1386 x 0.
10001.title: Non-Profit Management/Video Internship for NYC Theater/Community Center

This is an intensive Leadership Training Program in non-profit business management. Interns receive hands-on training in an award-winning theater conservatory and community service organization in New York City. Please note: The majority of the internship positions we offer are full-time (40 hours per week). However, we offer a limited number of part-time internships for candidate's that are maintaining a part-time job or a large class load during their internship. This is an exception and only serious candidates who have the ability and intention to fulfil the requirements of the internship will be considered. We are looking for individuals with the ability to lead, manage teams, work independently, communicate effectively on the phone, in person and in writing and interact in a fast-paced business environment. We are looking for leaders who can put their thoughts and insights into action; positive, enthusiastic individuals who want to make a difference in the world and are committed to upholding the legacy and tradition of theater in the belief that theater can change a life and make the world a better place for everyone. The interns' primary responsibility is to manage the daily administrative operations of the organization and to take a leadership role in programming initiatives. There will be opportunities to work closely with the senior staff: in administrating over workshops for actors and community programs that serve Youth-at-Risk. Under ATW supervision, interns will be accountable for projects in the management of ATW's studio rental business, administration, team management, marketing, development, sales, fund-raising, video production, event planning, and graphic design. For international applicants, only candidates with exceptional skills in speaking and writing in English will be considered. Only a limited number of part-time internships (24 to 30 hours per week) will be considered from qualified and serious applicants. Part-time internships are 3 to 18 months. This is a non-paid internship training program. To be considered, please apply ASAP. Go to http://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com to find out more and fill out an online application for this position! Only fully completed applications will be considered.

10001.description: Non-Profit Business Management Internship for Non-Profit Theater! This is an intensive Leadership Training Program in non-profit business management. Interns receive hands-on training in an award-winning theater arts and community service organization. We are looking for individuals with the ability to lead, manage teams, work independently, communicate effectively on the phone, in person and in writing and interact in a fast-paced business environment. We are looking for idealists and leaders who can put their thoughts and insights into action; positive, enthusiastic individuals who want to make a difference in the world and are committed to upholding the legacy and tradition of theater in the belief that theater can change a life and make the world a better place for everyone. The interns' primary responsibility is to manage the daily administrative operations of the organization and to take a leadership role in programming initiatives. There will be opportunities to work closely with the senior staff in administrating and producing on-going classes and workshops for professional actors and in community programs that serve Youth-at-Risk and homeless children. Under the supervision of the ATW staff, interns will be accountable for the completion of projects in management of ATW's studio rental business, administration, team management, marketing, development, sales, fund-raising, video production, event planning, and graphic design. For international applicants, English proficiency is required. Internships are available for 4 to 18 months in duration and are 40 hrs per week. This is a non-paid raining program. Application instructions: Go to www.actorstheatreworkshop.com to find out more and fill out an online application for this position! Please, be alert while filling it out, only fully completed applications will be considered.
10001.title: Non-Profit Management Internship for Theater/Community Center

10001.description: One of New York City's largest and most comprehensive social services agencies, BRC serves men and women who are homeless, or at risk of becoming so, most of whom suffer from mental illness, substance addiction, or a combination. BRC gives our clients the knowledge and skills to stay sober and healthy and the sense of responsibility and value to find and maintain a home--in other words, the means to achieve permanent independence. BRC helps these neediest New Yorkers overcome the challenges of addiction, physical and mental illness, and poverty, and improves life in the community. Outreach is BRC's program for homeless individuals living on the streets and in other unstable situations. It is the most extensive outreach program in New York City covering specific Manhattan based locations, i.e. Grand Central Station, Penn Station and Port Authority Bus Terminal, 5 days per week in vans and on foot. Outreach staff and volunteers engages homeless individuals with the goal of assessing each individual's situation and needs and providing each client with an accessible doorway to services they need. Clients are afforded referral, transportation and placement at the resource deemed most beneficial to the individual, and each is treated with respect, professionalism and informed guidance. The Outreach Team encounters many individuals that are reluctant to use services or have found the available resources unmanageable and overwhelming. These clients are provided with counseling, information and advocacy in pursuing services, rights and resources. Every individual engaged is given the opportunity to access the services most suited to their needs. Working with Outreach staff, volunteers will help refer clients to assessment shelters, drop-in centers, drug and alcohol treatment, psychiatric and medical facilities, job training centers and entitlement offices. Normally a staff-only position, volunteers are needed to help us continue in our Outreach efforts. All teams will be midtown Manhattan based specifically at the Port Authority Bus Terminal on either Wednesday of Thursday evenings from 7pm to 9:30pm. This is the perfect opportunity for friends or co-workers who want to get involved together because teams will be comprised of a minimum of three individuals per shift, with a maximum of four each. For more information or you would like to speak to someone directly, please contact Rick Akin, Director of Volunteer Services at BRC, at (212) 803-5720. PLEASE NOTE: In order to insure the integrity of the BRC volunteer program, as well as the well being of the clients we service, all interested parties must complete a New Volunteer Registration form and attend an orientation, prior to reeciving an assignmen t. Apologies, but we are unable to accept walk-ins.
10001.title: Become a Volunteer Outreach Team Member and help New York's homeless adults find their way home!

10001.description: We seek student video editors/shooters or those entering the industry who wish to make a meaningful commitment to established non-profit professional theatre and acting conservatory. Develop your skills and creativity under the guidance of our renowned Artistic Director and Founder, Thurman E. Scott. The project goal is to bring the power of our classes and programs to the public. Your work will have a lasting impact on our theatre and community. Founded over two decades ago The Actors Theatre Workshop (ATW) is an award winning non-profit theatre and community center serving as a laboratory for creative development. We offer professional acting training and community programs including Builders of the New World, a theatre and education program for homeless children. ATW has a library of over 1000 hours of unedited footage of Mr. Scott teaching his original creative process. We are now bringing this powerful material, currently available only to the students in ATW's Master Class, to a broader audience. We will create instructional documentaries to distribute on our website and other media. This valuable training material for actors and directors will bring powerful, effective theatre principles and techniques to people from all walks of life seeking to develop creatively and personally. Video Apprentices will serve as videographers in Mr. Scott's Master Class in which he teaches his original acting and creative process to professional actors. By participating in this unique professional scholarship program, members will receive an unparalleled learning experience through exposure to ground-breaking creative work and illuminating ideas. We seek applicants with training and experience in Final Cut Pro, http streaming, digital shooting, cataloging of footage, working with a web developer, and lighting and sound. Apprentices will work from pre- through post-production under the direction of a project manager and Mr. Scott. Members of the one or two year program will video-tape the two Master Classes each week, and spend 10 hours per week editing. We seek professional, curious, detail-oriented individuals with the desire and ability to engage in ATW's creative process. Thurman E. Scott is an award-winning actor, director, writer, producer, and master teacher of acting and creative process with over 30 years of professional experience. Stella Adler declared, \" Thurman E. Scott is the inheritor of the Stanislavsky legacy and of my legacy. His work advances acting technique for the next generation.\" Please complete an application in the \"Volunteer\" section at http://www.ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com. Please specify the Video Apprentice Program. Email us at Outreach@ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com or call 212-947-1386 ext. 0 with questions.
10001.title: Video Apprentice Positions for theatre documentary with acclaimed actor/director – exciting project

10001.description: Come Volunteer as a grade school teacher at our 300 student grade school located in Kabula, Kenya. Volunteer Kenya is a grassroots volunteer organization located in western Kenya. We run 4 humanitarian aid programs: (1) Healthcare, (2) HIV/AIDS Education, (3) Education, (4) Microenterprise Development. Volunteer Kenya / ICODEI is a non-religious, non-political volunteer organization run through a partnership of past overseas volunteers and local Kenyans. We are a grassroots organization with no marketing or fundraising overhead. All programs (including our heath clinic and grade school) are run through donations from volunteers and individual donors. Please visit our website at www.volunteerkenya.org

10001.description: We seek experienced and enthusiastic individuals to help get the word out about the Actors Theatre Workshop and to obtain media coverage for the many fascinating, compelling and as yet untold stories here. Rangel, the deepening of our faith that a theatre artist of Mr. Scott's caliber cares to loan his gifts to support his community, thereby building our hope for a vibrant and illuminating future. 10001.description: The Actors Theatre Workshop is offering a unique opportunity for individuals to be at the center of the vibrant cultural mix of diversity taking place in America, as reflected through plays and professional theatre expression. We are seeking panel members (directors, writers, actors, literary professionals) to read and evaluate play submissions for our Plays in Development Program. ATW is establishing its Plays in Development for young directors and playwrights to develop rehearse and present staged readings of their original, new plays, in keeping with the tradition of support for new and aspiring theatre artists. This exciting program will provide the selected playwrights and directors with a beautiful theatre facility in which to develop and produce their work as either a workshop production or staged reading. The panel will have the unique experience of giving playwrights a voice in the community and provide a venue to dramatize conflicts on the theatrical platform. We are interested in creating a diverse panel, made up of eight to ten directors, writers, actors, and literary professionals to read and select the winning plays for this contest. If you are interested in being a member of the panel to read the plays in this contest, please submit a resume and cover letter, as well as a response to the question below to: hr@ActorsTheatreWorkshop.com Question: Taking into consideration the multitude of diverse cultures emerging within our society, how does theatre address pertinent issues in a way that allows us to have a positive insight into these emerging new cultures? 10001.description: From time to time, BRC will host, or have hosted for us, special events such as book signings, a fundraising gala, crafts fairs, sporting events and more throughout the year. On these occasions, we need volunteers to assist us in various capacities such as setting up in preparation of the event and break down afterwards. We also require outgoing, friendly and engaging individuals who can assist in other roles such as ticket sales, check-in, coat check, traffic control, security and more. For more information or you would like to speak to someone directly, please contact Rick Akin, Director of Volunteer Services at BRC, at (212) 803-5720. PLEASE NOTE: In order to insure the integrity of the BRC volunteer program, as well as the well being of the clients we service, all interested parties must complete a New Volunteer Registration form and attend an orientation, prior to reeciving an assignmen t. Apologies, but we are unable to accept walk-ins.
10001.title: Help at a BRC Special Event

10001.description: Volunteers are needed to assist in various administrative assistant capacities from taking inventory, filing, document shredding, copying, internet research, data entry, reception and more. If you have the time, enjoy working with others in the social work field, and are flexible enough to do what needs to be done at a moment's notice, this is the job for you. Whether you have a couple of hours to spare, a full day, or if you would like to become a regular, long term assistant, we would love to hear from you. For more information or you would like to speak to someone directly, please contact Rick Akin, Director of Volunteer Services at BRC, at (212) 803-5720.
10001.title: Work alongside our great staff at BRC!

10002.description: The Spring Carnival is a day of games, playtime, music and all around fun! We are looking for approximately 20 volunteers to help out at various stations throughout the day so that the students can have a great time!
10002.title: P.S. 142 End-of-Year Carnival

10002.description: 12 volunteers needed to help at an evening event of science projects and discoveries with school families. Volunteers will assist in small experiments.
10002.title: P.S. 142 Science Night

10002.description: Global Potential (GP) is a non-profit organization founded in 2007. GP provides urban youth from low-income communities with an eighteen-month leadership program, giving them the skills and perspective to effect positive change in their lives and communities. Youth engage in leadership training, social entrepreneurship, international cultural exchange and service learning. GP's vision is that as youth develop, communities develop. Global Potential is currently seeking an individual for an Accounting Associate position. This position will primarily process, track and report financial transactions and will interact, in various degrees, with the CFO, CEO, Finance Committee and Program staff. Tasks and Responsibilities Prepare monthly and/or quarterly financial statement package for management and/or Board review. Research and explain budget-to-actual variances. Assist in the preparation of annual budget and quarterly re-forecasts. Includes maintenance of budget model, interaction with CFO, Program staff and/or Board members. Assist in the preparation and filing of GP financial and other information on various not-for-profit and regulatory websites (e.g., Charity Navigator, NY Charities Bureau). Assist in the preparation and submission of various grant applications/reimbursement requests (e.g., NY City Council, US Department of State). Assist in preparation of information required for annual audit and tax filings. Review all accounting transactions for adherence to organization’s accounting procedures and policies manual; work with staff to assure compliance. Work with staff to facilitate proper capture, recording, and reconciliation of summer program cash advances and expense reporting. Process and record all cash receipt and cash disbursement transactions in QuickBooks Online (QBO). Includes preparation of computer and manual checks, wire transfers and bank deposits. Monitor and record donation transactions from various funding platforms (e.g., Network for Good, Razoo, AmazonSmiles). Assist in processing payroll transactions and federal, state and/or local payroll tax filings by due dates. Monitor, record and reconcile petty cash transactions. Prepare monthly bank account reconciliations. Prepare QBO to Salesforce revenue reconciliations. Assist in maintenance and update of the chart of accounts, chart of departments and accounting policies and procedures manual. Skills and Knowledge Self-motivated, detail-oriented, highly organized, enthusiastic personality. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Strong communication, organizational and time-management skills. Strong computer skills (Mac or PC). Intermediate-level understanding of accounting (i.e., more than a single, basic-level accounting course). Knowledge of non-profit accounting a plus. Working familiarity with general ledger applications. Knowledge of QBO a plus. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word (knowledge of PowerPoint a plus). Knowledge of Google applications (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Drive) a plus Knowledge of Salesforce a plus. Education: Degree in Accounting or other financial / business discipline or current degree-seeking (major or minor) accounting student. Commitment 8-15 hours weekly for at least 6 months.
10002.title: Accounting Associate

10002.description: Global Potential (GP) transforms youth from underserved communities through education, service learning and cultural exchange into globally competitive leaders of positive change in their lives and communities. GP is an 18-month transformative out-of-school time and summer program based in New York City. The GP program includes 14.5 months of workshops locally and 1.5 months of international service learning and cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. Global Potential seeks energetic facilitators to help us conduct preparatory workshops and evaluations with youth and community members Facilitate participatory dialogue between GP partner communities, GP youth councils, local leaders (international), partner high schools (local), NGOs (IDDI, CEDESO, Peace Corps, World Vision, Municipal Government), GP youth, and the GP staff team to ensure empowerment of the community and equal and respectful power dynamic Attend staff meetings, conferences, external meetings, professional development trainings, conference calls, webinars, and networking events as appropriate Provide and receive feedback to/from supervisors locally and internationally, report back to supervisors on a weekly basis on all tasks Job type: Volunteer Job location: Nicaragua, the Dominican Republic, Haiti Volunteer Fees: All expenses covered by Global Potential (including flight and accomodations & meals) Job length: 4 Months Start date - End date: May 1-August 31, 2017 Commitment hours: 10-15 hours per week in May and June; full time+ from July 1st to August 18th (approximate dates) with 2 days/1 night off (contingent upon coordination with your team and community); 10-15 hours per week after trip to deliver all paperwork. Position reports to: Chief Program Officer or International Program Director and Field Staff Director Specific responsibilities: Guide workshops, youth development, evaluation, and needs and impact assessments Work closely with GP youth participants to provide support for youths’ personal development through weekly individual and group advisory/evaluation meetings Work together as team members and role models with GP youth participants and GP’s Youth Councils on infrastructure and social development projects in GP partner communities Work closely with GP Youth Councils in administering evaluation and needs and impact assessments, organizing community service events, workshops, and conducting site visits Collaborate in the planning and implementation of the GP Youth Leadership Conference Other Work Requirements: Adhere to GP’s rules and procedures, including time and duty commitments; commitment to learning new technologies and social media platforms; and maintenance of GP’s cloud-based office spaces. Be open-minded, adaptable, flexible, culturally sensitive, professional, respectful, tolerant, and work to build solidarity with the communities we serve. Ensure a SAFE and EDUCATIONAL experience for staff, youth, and community members. Be an integral part of the team and the daily life of the youth participants. Skills and Knowledge Requirements: Creation and management of groups, teaching and/or facilitating group discussions. Experience working with youth and communities that are historically marginalized. Ability to be both a leader and a compatriot, an inspiration and a guide to youth participants. Experience living in challenging conditions and rural areas internationally. Adept interpersonal skills; strength in developing and maintaining relationships with youth, families, community members, GP staff, and partnering agencies. Self-motivated and capable of working independently as well as with a team. Bi-lingual (Spanish or Haitian Creole) speakers with experience working and living in developing countries are especially encouraged to apply. We are especially interested in individuals who would like to remain involved after the summer. Education/Field: Graduate degree or in process preferred. College degree required (unless significant equivalent experience can be demonstrated) Appropriate fields include: Social Work, Education, International Development, Counseling Psychology, Anthropology, Media, Arts, Social Entrepreneurship, Political Science, Health/Fitness/Outdoors. Certification in First Aid/CPR preferred What we can offer you: An opportunity to be exposed to the workings of a nonprofit grassroots enterprise with a vast network of innovative professionals. Exposure and access to the NGO and international development community. Training in an organization that is fast-paced, innovative, collaborative and creative. Impact: Youth and Volunteers who participate in GP demonstrate increased: Skills in advocacy, activism, fundraising, and social entrepreneurship. Self-esteem, confidence, and sense of purpose. Belief that challenges lead to opportunities. Academic completion rates. Unprecedented professional experience in youth and international development. Interested candidates should immediately send cover letter and resume to hr@global-potential.org. Indicate \"International Youth Development Facilitator\" in the subject line.
10002.title: Summer Abroad: Youth Development Facilitator

Event: Steve Nash Foundation Showdown Date: June 21, 2017 Location: Sara D. Roosevelt Park (Lower East Side, NYC) Hours: We can accommodate volunteers for 4-8 hour shifts between 7am and 10pm. We will also require attendance at an in-person volunteer team meeting on Monday, June 19. Our team will be in touch with you about this volunteer opportunity to schedule a follow up call. APPLY HERE: https://goo.gl/forms/3mJkPieozveMRDi03

10002.description: Reading Empowers was formed with the mission of improving literacy among young children. Our goal is to instill an interest in reading, at a young age, and our hope is that this will develop into a lifelong love and passion. This upcoming school semester (Spring 2017), we will be hosting Saturday morning reading sessions at P.S. 1 and P.S. 124 in Lower Manhattan. We are looking for volunteers to join us on our mission! We will be reading to students in 1st, 2nd, and 3rd Grade. P.S. 1 and P.S. 124 are both located in Chinatown at 8 Henry Street and 40 Division Street, repsectively, in LES Manhattan. Below are the dates for the Spring 2017 semester. February 11 March 4 March 18 April 1 April 22 April 29 Each session is about two hours, during which volunteers and students are broken up into groups, with each group consisting of 2-3 volunteers and 6-8 students. The two hour sessions consist of reading, writing, and an arts and crafts activity with the students. Reading Empowers is a non-profit organization in the state of New York and recognized as a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) organization by the IRS. Please feel free to visit our website http://www.readingempowers.org/ Requirements Volunteers must be 18 or older New volunteers must pass the background check with our vendor, Go Pass. There is a $60 background check fee that will be reimbursed to you after you volunteer with us for 60% of all the sessions in one full school year ~ 8-9 sessions We are looking for consistent commitment for this school year, which is roughly two Saturdays per month To get involved please fill out our online application at: www.readingempowers.org/application
10002.title: Read to 1st, 2nd or 3rd Graders in a public school in Lower Manhattan!

10002.description: We are looking for Volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of elders and youth through our wonderful Empathy Revolution. Use your skills, experience, knowledge, creativity and talent to bring together elders, youth, and community. AIF wants to bring about an \"Empathy Revolution\" in eldercare and education. AIF provides a forum for the creation of open-source education, tools, and community creation. The goal is a future with more humane aging and more humane growing up! Become a member of our dynamic and creative Film Team and help us create Alive Inside 2. We are also a documentary Film company and would love Volunteers interested in making wonder uplifting documentaries Work from our Manhattan office or remotely. Enhance your resume and get a glowing letter of recommendation.
10002.title: Volunteer with The Alive Inside Foundation & Join The Empathy Revolution!

10002.description: One Teaching Assistant and two Office Assistants are needed. Bilingual Mandarin or Cantonese speakers are preferred. Teaching Assistant will assist in adult literacy, citizenship, employment training classes. Office Assistants will assist in information, services, registration, food distribution, and other office work.
10002.title: Teaching and Office Assistance

10002.description: Help us fight climate change and hunger by delivering excess food to a local homeless shelter. You will be walking with bags of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. You will visit the store a few minutes before closing time, pick up the edible food in a plastic bag, and deliver the food to a local shelter.
10002.title: Fight climate change by rescuing food waste

10002.description: Global Potential (GP) transforms youth from underserved communities through education, service learning and cultural exchange into globally competitive leaders of positive change in their lives and communities. GP is an 16-month transformative after-school and summer program that works with 500 youth a year in New York City. The GP program includes 14.5 months of workshops locally and 1.5 months of international service learning and cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. We are seeking a highly motivated, focused, outgoing individual to coordinate activities involved in managing and organize internal and external communications aimed at creating encouraging point-of-view among stakeholders on which the company depends . The Corporate Relations Coordinator will be integral in sustaining this growth, making a significant contribution to the organization and the youth we serve. As the coordinator of corporate relations you will play an integral role in integrating Global Potential's mission, values and goals to stakeholders. This is an opportunity for a motivated self-starter interested in helping to implement our fundraising strategy over the course of the next year. You will be spearheading fundraising efforts and delegating tasks to other staff interns while receiving support and guidance from the Director of Operations . Position reports to: Director of Operations, Executive Director Responsibilities include: - Attending events in the community to engage new members and donors - Becoming familiar with the inner workings of a non-profit organization QUALIFICATIONS (Who we are looking for): Skills and Knowledge Solid writing, communication, organizational and time management skills Self-motivated, detail-oriented, enthusiastic personality Ability to work independently and creatively, as well as part of a team Strong computer skills (PC or MAC): Microsoft Office, Internet Spanish or French Language a plus Other work requirements: Passionate about underserved youth and commitment to GP mission, Interest in working with non-profits or in international development. Proven interest in corporate relations a plus In terested candidates should send cover letter and resume to hr@global-potential.org . Indicate \"Corporate Relations\" in the subject line.
10002.title: Corporate Relations Coordinator

10002.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Ivi Wakneen, Coordinator of Volunteer Services; (212)-649-5264 or iwakneen@mjhs.org
10002.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Manhattan!

10002.description: Putting together heart inspiring videos of 1 min and 3 mins long for a Free Environmental Summer Camp out of South Bronx and Lower east Side. Video clips and images have been gathered from various hand-held devices, ready for editing. Helpful Description of our Free Environmental Summer Camp from the South Bronx: The campers and their families will gain hard skills learned from adaptive rock climbing, hiking, and camping. They will also gain valuable skills such as communication, discernment, critical thinking and foresight to help them thrive in the challenging environment of the South Bronx. Our program helps the campers to take this shared sacred state in the outdoors back to NYC to empower our urban communities. We also run a 6 week long Summer Camp in the Lower East Side in the Children's Magical Garden.
10002.title: Creating heart inspiring videos of 1-3 mins long for Free Environmental Summer Camp

10002.description: Chess Tutors are needed at our Seward Park Library in Manhattan. Tutors should be willing to work with a small group of youth or teens and adults who wish to learn the basics of chess. Saturdays, 1pm - 3pm. Once a week. Six month commitment necessary.
10002.title: Chess Tutor

10002.description: ABOUT THE MATERIALS CENTER: The Materials Center at Manny Cantor Center is a community resource that houses a large collection of \"found\" materials, gathered and donated by New York City residents and businesses. These materials are objects from our everyday lives that are often discarded, but could be repurposed or transformed into something new, encouraging creativity, problem solving, and action. We believe that these materials can enhance and enrich children’s learning, creative expression, and symbolic development. The Materials Center is made possible through a partnership with Teaching Beyond the Square. ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY: You'll be helping to organize and sort materials! Responsibilities will include weighing-in donations, sifting through donated materials, sorting them into the areas/shelves/containers, prepping materials, and straightening up the areas to look more beautiful. This opportunity requires no prior knowledge. We will share with you what you need to get started. It is a great way to relax too. We have half hour and hour shifts to sign-up for (you can choose as many or as little as you want), but even if you can only stop by for 15 minutes you can make a difference! This is also a fun opportunity for families to do together.
10002.title: Sorting in our Materials Center (Mondays)!

10002.description: Help serve lunch to older adults on the Lower East Side to ensure they have a hot, healthy meal to eat! Each day about 150 seniors attend lunch at the Weinberg Center for Balanced living and our volunteer lunch servers are an integral part in ensuring it all goes smoothly. Doing everything from setting tables, plating food and delivering the meals to each table, it is always a fun and meaningful experience for all. The Weinberg Center for Balanced Living at Manny Cantor Center serves a diverse population of 60+ adults with everything from nutritious kosher meals, health and wellness programs, case workers, dance, art, language and fitness classes and a wide array of social events. Currently there are 4,000 members and growing to take advantage of this diverse array of mostly free programming. Key Responsibilities: Set tables with numbers, cutlery, napkins, condiments and water prior to meals Ensure cleanliness of tables and room both before, during and after meals Serve meals to seniors once they are seated Collect tickets from seniors in exchange for their meal Qualifications Needed: This is a customer service position, so best for people that are friendly and personable Strong verbal communications skills Professional demeanor Some experience in food service is a plus Some experience interacting with seniors is a plus Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F 11:00am-1:00pm Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Food Handler Training: You will receive hands on training during your first shift and in subsequent shifts, if necessary Support: Program Supervisor available to answer questions and provide instructions when needed Benefits: Gain knowledge of working in a Community Center and with older adults, while giving back to your community Volunteer meet-ups, which will include learning opportunities, social and networking events and more Tracking of your volunteer hours for your company, school or affiliated group Discounted membership to Manny Cantor Center Fitness Center (must volunteer 12 hours per month to be eligible) Next Steps: Fill out our application: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/application/ For more information visit: http://mannycantor.org/volunteer/
10002.title: Serve Lunch to Older Adults on LES!

10002.description: Purpose of Role: Assist in the preparation of meals and efficiency of the MCC kitchen as it prepares meals for our Older Adult and Early Childhood programs. As a kitchen volunteer, you will play an integral role in the preparation of hundreds of meals on a daily basis. Location: Manny Cantor Center, 197 E. Broadway, New York, NY 10002 Key Responsibilities: Chop, peel and prepare food for cooking Ensure cleanliness of all dishes, cutlery, equipment, etc. Qualifications Needed: Basic kitchen skills is required Some experience volunteering or working in a kitchen is a plus Some experience in food service is a plus Understand and practice good hygiene Time Commitment: Shifts available M-F, 7am-2:30pm Minimum 2 hour shift, once/week Training/Support/Supervisor: Program Supervisor: Executive Chef Training: You will receive hands on training during your first two shifts Assessment: You and your supervisor will discuss the best role for you following your training shifts Support: Ongoing two-way feedback from program supervisor and volunteer manager, additional trainings and professional development opportunities may be available. Benefits: Gain knowledge of working in a fast-paced kitchen and valuable experience in food service Volunteer meet-ups, which will include learning opportunities, social and networking events and more Tracking of your volunteer hours for your company, school or affiliated group Discounted membership to Manny Cantor Center Fitness Center (12 volunteer hours a month to be eligible) Requirements: Fill out volunteer application Phone screening with Volunteer staff In-person interview with Kitchen program staff
10002.title: Prepare Meals for Children & Older Adults in the Lower East Side!

10002.description: Youth Ambassador Program is funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs and administered by Global Potential. YAP program builds relationships and creates networks among Haitian youth leaders, training youth in the concepts and practices of Social Entrepreneurship; introducing youth to leaders in nonprofit and change-making organizations in the US; and learning about US families, culture, geography, and socio-economic realities YAP consists of three phases: Phase 1, YAP Fellows participate in monthly workshops. These workshops are based on a 4-module curriculum of community service, leadership development, civic education and participatory democracy; Phase 2, YAP Fellows participate in a 3-week immersive experience in the U.S., visiting New York City, Washington D.C.; Phase 3, YAP Leaders are given both individual and group support and coaching for 7 months to develop projects that will impact their local communities, based on their passions and abilities. Global Potential (GP) empowers youth and communities to energize each other through education, international service work and cultural exchange. GP is an 18-month transformative after-school + summer program that works with 500 youth a year. The GP program includes 16.5 months of workshops locally New York and 1.5 months of international cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. The Youth Ambassador Program Associate is responsible for assisting the Program Coordinator with all YAP program related tasks that is logistics, coordination and operations of YAP. Duties and Responsibilities: Ensure that all files and data are organized properly Input information of YAP participants into the database (salesforce & Google Drive) Manage the Youth Ambassador Program Facebook pages and Google Drive Make phone calls when needed to YAP partners and participants Support in the recruitment of YAP Participants Participate in the Monthly conference calls with the International Executive Councils Translate Documents from English to Haitian Creole and vice versa. Take notes and minutes during Conference calls, partner meetings, Youth monthly workshop Follow up with tasks assigned to the YAP Youth Update Youth, Staff and Partner Contact Information Follow up with YAP participants Help identifying new partners and communities Update the YAP Timeline and summarize weekly meeting notes Maintain support, confidentiality, and professionalism necessary to create a safe atmosphere of sharing, understanding, tolerance and mutual support. Qualifications: Currently in High School; Seniors Prefered; Must be able to commit for a minimum of 6 months, flexible schedule; Must be able to speak and write Haitian Creole or French; Proficiency in using social media platforms including Facebook, Google Hangout, Twitter and Instagram Be familiar with Google Spreadsheets, Google Doc, Google Hangout, and Salesforce (or be willing to receive basic training for use of these systems); Detailed oriented, responsible, organized, sociable with excellent communication skills; Strong listening and communication skills; Practical problem-solving skills and ability to suggest options and alternatives; and Sensitivity to persons of different educational, economic, cultural or ethnic backgrounds.
10002.title: Youth Ambassador Program Associate NYC

10002.description: Youth Ambassador Program is funded by the U.S. Department of State's Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, youth division; administered by Global Potential. YAP program builds relationships and creates networks among Haitian youth leaders, training youth in the concepts and practices of Social Entrepreneurship; introducing youth to leaders in nonprofit and change-making organizations in the US; and learning about US families, culture, geography, and socio-economic realities YAP consists of three phases: Phase 1, YAP Fellows participate in monthly workshops. These workshops are based on a 4-module curriculum of community service, leadership development, civic education and participatory democracy; Phase 2, YAP Fellows participate in a 3-week immersive experience in the U.S., visiting New York City, Washington D.C.; Phase 3, YAP Leaders are given both individual and group support and coaching for 7 months to develop projects that will impact their local communities, based on their passions and abilities. Global Potential (GP) empowers youth and communities to energize each other through education, international service work and cultural exchange. GP is an 18-month transformative after-school + summer program that works with 500 youth a year. The GP program includes 16.5 months of workshops locally New York and 1.5 months of international cultural exchange in the Dominican Republic, Haiti, and Nicaragua. The Youth Ambassador Program Coordinator is responsible for assisting the Senior Program Coordinator with all program related tasks including logistics, coordination, and operations of YAP. Duties and Responsibilities: Candidate with High school diploma; college student preferred Adhere to the YAP operations timeline and summarize weekly meeting notes Ensure that all files and data are organized and inputted appropriately into Salesforce and Google Drive Translate Documents from English to Haitian Creole and vice versa. Support in the recruitment of YAP participants Coach YAP participants throughout the recruitment and program period Communicate with and mobilize international partners and participants via phone, Facebook, Hangout, email, etc Support in identifying new partners and communities in Haiti Facilitate participatory dialogue between GP/YAP partner communities and local leaders (international), partner NGOs, YAP youth, and the GP/YAP staff team to ensure empowerment of the community and equal and respectful power dynamic. Coordinate and attend bi-weekly meetings with colleagues based in Haiti Whenever possible, seek out Strategic Partnership and Cultivation opportunities with agencies serving youth and foundations/corporations/individuals granting funds to support YAP and GP’s work Ensure maintenance, organization, and cleanliness of Global Potential’s cloud-based office spaces, including but not limited to: Salesforce, Google Docs, Google Calendar, Gmail, Facebook Pages and Groups. Maintain support, confidentiality, and professionalism necessary to create a safe atmosphere of sharing, understanding, tolerance and mutual support and respect. Qualifications: Candidate with High school diploma; college student preferred Must be able to commit for a minimum of 6 months, 15 hours a week Must be able to speak and write Haitian Creole or French; Proficiency in using social media platforms including Facebook, Google Hangout, Twitter and Instagram Be familiar with Google Spreadsheets, Google Doc, Google Hangout, and Salesforce (or be willing to receive basic training for use of these systems) Experience with Salesforce is a plus Detailed oriented, responsible, organized, sociable with excellent communication skills Ability to communicate with teenagers openly and nonjudgmentally; Strong listening and communication skills; Ability to establish a relationship based on equal respect; Practical problem-solving skills and ability to suggest options and alternatives; and Sensitivity to persons of different educational, economic, cultural or ethnic backgrounds. Education Requirement Must be currently pursuing a degree in one of the following fields: Nonprofit Management, Psychology, Counseling, Sociology, or human services related fields of study, or have previous experience Must have completed Sophomore year in college
10002.title: Youth Ambassador Program Coordinator NYC

10002.description: Bike New York offers free bike education classes in all five boroughs from April to December, and they are all taught with help from our wonderful volunteers. In addition, volunteers have the opportunity to be a part of our various events including the largest charity ride in America, the TD Five Boro Bike Tour Presented by REI! Training only takes an hour, and the volunteer commitment is totally up to you. Learn how to teach someone to ride and you'll change someone's life!
10002.title: Want to teach someone how to ride a bike?

10002.description: This opportunity is available every Wednesday, & Sunday morning! We deliver food that would otherwise have been thrown away to homeless shelters to feed the homeless and food insecure in NYC. You can help: pick up the leftover food from a popular LES restaurant and deliver it on-foot to the nearby Bowery Mission! Volunteer for just 30 minutes per week and make a huge impact!
