10030.description: We are trying to start a coding and or robotics program for students in Central Harlem. Volunteers need that are interested in teaching and coaching High School students on how to write codes and develop the skills needed to build , understand and compete in the robotics field.
10030.title: ROBOTICS OR CODING VOLUNTEER NEEDED

10030.description: Behind the Book is a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. We bring accomplished authors into high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects. Our rich, innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula and meet Common Core Learning Standards, have a record of building literacy skills and creating engaged, motivated readers at schools around the city. BtB is looking for volunteer photographers and videographers to document students and authors during classroom workshops and field trips. This is a challenging task involving several children and a lot of activity, so it's a plus if you have experience with pre-K to high school-age students. Photographers may also cover events for fundraising and events. Images might appear in social media, organizatio publications, and/or the books written and illustrated by our students as their classroom projects. To apply, or for more information, please contact volunteer@behindthebook.org. Include a link to your website, portfolio or samples of your work.
10030.title: Photographer/Videographer

10030.description: Are you an evangelist for getting more girls and young women interested in STEM? Have a knack for teaching or encouraging students to try new things?Then this is the perfect activity for you! Come join us in events that is geared to inspiring young women and girls to BE all they can be. The theme of the overall summit: Mind, Body, Spirit. STEM Kids NYC will be facilitating hackathon workshops throughout the summer, called STEM-Fabulous!, which will be a series of hacktivities that include: 1. Building an app that addresses an issue affecting young women and girls 2. Designing chemical free skin care products 3. Engineering an invention that will revolutionize the ___ industry (the young engineers will fill in the blanks) No STEM experience necessary. We are looking to involve as many volunteers who can serve as those 'holding the space' and supporting the STEM-Fabulous participants in using their creativity and ingenuity to make things that inspire their mind, body, and spirit.
10030.title: Young Women and STEMpowerment!

10030.description: We're looking for Raspberry Pi GURUS who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students in grades 3-8, with instruction on creating with Raspberry Pi. The creations will be entered into a competition where they will be judged on creativity and Ingenuity. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning program on Raspberry Pi. If you are into Scratch, Raspberry Pi, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students in HARLEM!
10030.title: Make Fun With Raspberry Pi!

10030.description: We're looking for instructors who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students in grades 6, 7, and 8 with instruction on app development, website development, robotics, or game development. You will be on the cutting edge of teaching computer science concepts, as less than 10% of New York City and Northern New Jersey public schools has a computer science curriculum! What's more, 10% of US schools have a computer science curriculum. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning wireframing, weibsite, app & game development. We operate within an afterschool model, in that schools and community based organizations utilize our expertise to provide quality programming to their students and program participants. Your schedule and availability will be matched with the school or community-based afterschool program. If you are into Scratch, Arduino, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students in Harlem!
10030.title: Scratch, HTML, JAVA Instructors Needed - NYC!

10030.description: Join the volunteer team at Behind the Book, a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. We bring accomplished authors and illustrators into pre-K-12th grade classrooms in high-needs schools, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. Our rich, innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula and meet Common Core Learning Standards, have a successful record of building literacy skills and creating motivated readers at schools around the city. You need no experience or training to volunteer as a writing, research or art coach, or in another active role to engage and encourage students as they work on their projects. You might help a student edit a short story or essay, guide small groups in researching animals or civil rights issues, or oversee kids creating collages, drawings, or murals. Individual workshops run about 90 minutes on a school day, usually in the morning. You can participate in any number of workshops in a program series of 3 to 6 dates, scheduled over a few weeks. With a slate of wonderful authors leading creative, thought-provoking programs every school year, you'll find many workshops you'll want to be part of. For dates of upcoming workshops, including the anchor books, authors, and descriptions of the class project, please visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/ For more information, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org.
10030.title: Classroom Volunteer/Writing Coach

10156.description: Foster a cat or kitten in your home for two-three weeks until \"room\" opens up at the KittyKind adoption center. KittyKind is a no-kill, all volunteer, non-profit, cat rescue group. In space that the Petco Corporation donates, KittyKind adopts over 1,500 rescued cats a year, into loving homes. www.kittykind.org (Petco, 17th Street & Broadway, NYC) When space is full at the adoption center, foster parents provide temporary care. This opportunity is great for people who travel a lot and cannot commit to full-time care, for people who want the company of a pet but not on a full-time basis. Please let me know if you're interested, and we can discuss the details further. Your home helps to save a cat! Thanks.
10156.title: Foster Parents for Pets

10162.description: Simply by using your vehicle you can save animals - Volunteer your time to transport animals along what is called a \"Rescue Relay Transport\". Each week there are hundreds of animal rescue transports taking place where animals are moved from high-kill shelters to no-kill shelters and rescue organizations, as well as foster homes and adopters. It's easy for you to get involved and help save more animals simply by driving a leg in this relay. How it works: 1. Sign-up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \" Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and specify the days you're available, the distance you're willing to drive, and then sit back and we'll do the rest. 2. When an animal rescue organization posts a transport request, the system will automatically search to see if it matches your profile (if you're available and within the distance) and then it automatically sends you an e-mail. 3. Then you simply click on the leg that you can cover and everyone else will see that you've signed up for that leg. 4. You'll get communications from the transport coordinator and, once the transport is a \"go\", you simply drive to the meeting place, load up the animals, and drive them to the next meeting place to hand them off to the next volunteer. You'll get plenty of doggy kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. There are videos on www.doobert.com that walk you through the process and give you tips and tricks on how to do transport. It's simple - and we need volunteers across the country, so share with your friends and help save an animal today!
10162.title: Drive a leg – Save a life! - New York, NY

10162.description: Loaning an animal your couch can save their life! - Every 16 seconds an animal is euthanized simply due to overpopulation. Shelters do not have unlimited space and unfortunately have to make room. Rescue groups do not have the facilities and rely on fosters to help. Simply by agreeing to foster you can save an animal’s life. ARF’s German Shepherd Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com, the leading online forum for animal rescues, animal shelters and volunteers, to help get more foster homes for rescue animals. How it works: 1. Sign up on Doobert.com or use the Facebook plug-in (search for \"Doobert Rescue\" on Facebook) and build your foster profile for how you can help foster animals. You get to pick the type, duration and tell potential shelters and rescues about your situation. It’s up to you what information you share. 2. We allow approved animal welfare organizations (Shelters and Rescues) to search for volunteers like you, based upon distance and your foster profile. They can see the information you’ve shared and reach out to you if there is a match. 3. You’ll be contacted by them directly and can determine if you are able to help that particular organization with fostering either overnight, short-term or longer-term. It’s up to you whether you help when you’re contacted. You'll get plenty of doggy and kitty kisses and thank you's along the way as the animals know you are there to help them. And there are many more ways to help volunteer to save animals on Doobert.com. It's simple and we need volunteers across the country - so share with your friends, family, and co-workers and help save an animal today!
10162.title: Let me crash on your couch… please? - New York, NY

10162.description: Pilots to the Rescue is seeking active and inactive pilots to help save animals. Even if you lost your medical, are not able to be PIC, or just can't afford to fly regularly, we need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals to safety but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Pilots to the Rescue is partnering with Doobert.com to manage these transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances it’s more ideal to have pilots involved, but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll send you information to get up to speed on being a volunteer pilot, or training videos to be a coordinator. If you're interested in being a coordinator we'll get you connected with a Rescue or Shelter to plan the transports. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Punch holes in the sky & save animals! - Pilots Wanted! - New York, NY

10162.description: We need animal rescue transport coordinators to help organize rescue transports. So whether you are retired, not able to travel, or just looking for a way to save animals, we need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go, but we need volunteer transport coordinators to help set up and manage the trip. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport request, we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their transport. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Do you have a computer and a phone?  You can save animals! - New York, NY

10162.description: We need pilots to help coordinate animal rescue transport flights for other pilots that are transporting animals. So whether you are a current pilot, retired pilot or you lost your medical, we still need you! Did you know that every 16 seconds in the U.S. an animal is euthanized due to overpopulation? Animal Rescues and Shelters do their best to move the animals around but need volunteers to transport the animals to their forever homes. Rescues and Shelters use Doobert.com to create their transport requests to get the animals where they need to go. For longer distances, it’s more ideal to have pilots involved but to plan these requests you need to have a working knowledge of General Aviation airports, how weight & balance works, and how to incorporate volunteer pilots’ needs into the transport request. You don’t even have to leave your home. All you need is a computer and a phone and we’ll train you how to do it. How it works: Let us know you can help by responding to this post! We’ll connect you with one of our experienced transport coordinator volunteers to set up time to get you trained on the Doobert.com system. When there’s a transport flight request we’ll connect you with the requesting organization to help them effectively plan and manage their flight. That’s it! And we’ll be here to support you all along the way. It's simple and we always need more volunteers (drivers, pilots, photographers, fosters, etc.) across the country, so share with your friends, family and co-workers and help us save an animal today!
10162.title: Are you a pilot?  Then you can save animals! - New York, NY

10032.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our innovative programs, accomplished authors lead workshops in high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing and art projects based on the theme of the author's book. No experience or training is necessary to work with students. As a writing, research or art coach, you'll engage them and encourage their progress on a project. This workshop needs your support at an elementary school in Inwood. To sign up, please contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code: Program 44SA-T Date: Thursday, May 11th, 2017 Time: Two consecutive classes: 8:30 - 9:30 AM & 9:40 - 10:40 AM (sign up for one or both) Volunteer Role: Writing coach Overview: Selina Alko’s The Case for Loving, about the landmark Supreme Court decision that invalidated laws prohibiting interracial marriage, is the basis for fourth-graders to study how laws have changed to better protect human rights, and determine if current laws are adequate. To reinforce their research, students will visit the United Nations to be introduced to the Security Council’s work promoting human rights. Coaches will guide them in writing about what they’ve learned. To find other Behind the Book programs around the city, visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new volunteer opportunities as they're posted, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10032.title: Writing coach for Washington Heights, NYC public school literacy program

10032.description: Opportunity: The Wa-Shokuiku Project is a new initiative from TABLE FOR TWO USA* which provides practical application to the universal principles found in washoku, or Japanese cuisine, through free afterschool educational programming for elementary school students . Through guided lessons and activities, students will learn about well-known foods such as sushi, which many already recognize as Japanese, as well as other home-style dishes such as miso soup and onigiri (riceballs) which can be easily prepared. Through these interactive programs, we hope to instill a deeper understanding of Japanese food and culture while equipping them with lifelong practical knowledge and skills about one of the world’s healthiest diets. Our Cooking Instructors and Volunteers will implement and teach the Wa-Shokuiku Curricula in schools across New York City, Washington D.C., and Boston. Instructing children about Japanese cuisine (washoku) and food education concepts, the cooking instructors will help to introduce children to cuisine and culture which many are learning about for the first time. Volunteer Responsibilities: Assist the Cooking Instructor in cooking and curricula implementation. Oversee and assist the safe participation of young student cooks. Encourage interest in Japanese food and culture. Coordinate with the Instructor and other key Wa-Shokuiku staff to gather information, data, and resources on the success of our programs. Time Commitment: At least 2 hour for training and orientation. Approximately 2-2.5 hours per week for lesson preparation, travel time, class time, set-up and clean-up during program period duration. About the Wa-Shokuiku Project: * TABLE FOR TWO USA (TFT) is a 501(C)(3) organization that that addresses the opposite issues of hunger and obesity through a unique \"meal-sharing\" program. TFT partners with corporations, restaurants, schools and other food establishments to serve healthy, low- calorie, TFT-branded meals. For each one of these healthy meals served, a small portion of the cost is donated to provide one school meal for a child in need. In this way, TFT has served healthy meals to both sides of the \"table\" and helped to right the global food imbalance. TFT started in Japan and now operates in 14 countries. As one of the most well-known NPOs in Japan which is noted for the longevity of its people, TFT promotes Japanese healthy eating culture as well to tackle the critical health issues. Learn more at: http://usa.tablefor2.org
10032.title: Volunteer Support for Japanese Food Education Class

10032.description: Nonprofit TABLE FOR TWO seeks a volunteer Photographer or Videographer for the launch of our new Japanese-inspired food education \"Wa-Shokuiku Project.\" Our program offers free Japanese cooking classes to children in New York City Schools, teaching them not only about Japanese food and food culture, but mindfulness and appreciation towards food and the environment. We are seeking photos/videos of students participating in the cooking class. The photos/videos will be used for our website, social media and other development materials. TABLE FOR TWO is an award-winning non-profit organization with a mission to promote healthy eating around the world (we have received many international social entrepreneurship awards). Let's make a difference!
10032.title: Photographer/Videographer for Kids Food Education Event! NYC

10032.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide academic support in reading and writing for the Sugar Hill Project’s Homework Club this Spring. Sessions meet three times each week on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. The sessions run from 3:00 - 5:30 PM. This is a great opportunity for students who are majoring (or have already earned a degree) in the course area to enhance their knowledge and experience and who are interested in tutoring. In this role, you would take the lead to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by City Tutor’s coordinators. The tutor for Sugar Hill Project’s Homework club is expected to commit a minimum of an hour and a half to support one of the above-mentioned days. You would identify and support students who are struggling, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Spring semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having tutors in these sessions early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about Sugar Hill Project here: http://www.bhc.org/sugarhill/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
10032.title: Reading/Writing tutor needed for Sugar Hill Broadway Housing Communities

10032.description: The City Tutors (CT) provides in-class academic support for a 9th grade algebra class (a total of little more than 30 students) at Community Health Academy High School (located a block away from the 157th stop on the 1 train). The teacher has really enjoyed working with City Tutors, and we would like to continue to support her course in Spring 2016. The tutor would attend the class on Weds from 1:56-2:48PM. This is a great opportunity for individuals who have a strong foundation in the material, and are interested in gaining practical experience working in the classroom. As an embedded tutor, you will collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance, while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. All embedded tutors commit three hours for the week. You will sit in on the class, and sometimes provide tutoring support after class (or on a different day if that's more agreeable) depending on students’ availability and interest. You will speak with the instructor weekly to prep for the next class and debrief after the Wed session. You would identify and support students who are struggling and provide feedback to the instructor regarding students' concerns and difficulties that can lead to changes in future lessons. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. CT's embedded tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model at the site. To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor. Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have received a degree recently. Be willing to complete 11.5 hours of College Reading and Learning Aligned (CRLA) training at City College of New York. We can accommodate your schedule for the training sessions.
10032.title: In-Class Tutoring Support for a 9th Grade Algebra Class

10032.description: Are you age 61 or older? Would you like to help scientists learn about language? Please consider participating in our research study! Study involves approximately 2 hours of interesting pencil and paper language tasks and you will receive $40 for your participation. Location: Either Columbia University Medical Center (transportation costs reimbursed) or your home at your convenience! Requirements: Must be in good health (e.g. no neurological or psychiatric disorders) and must be age 61 or older. Please call Alicia at (212) 305-1801 or email at aw2165@columbia.edu to learn more about the study
10032.title: Paid Research Study - Adults Ages 61 and Older
10032.org: Columbia University Medical Center/National Center for Children in Poverty

10032.description: Sunrise on Wheels brings the fun of day camp to children in hospitals. We play games and toys with children, have arts and crafts projects and we seek to help the children get through a very difficfult day with a little fun and laughter.
10032.title: Sunrise on Wheels Hospital Volunteer

10075.description: We are always looking for new volunteers to join our NYC chapter of the Action Corps. This is a rewarding volunteer opportunity that allows the individuals to cultivate their leadership skills and creativity, all while fighting global poverty and hunger. Action Corps is a national, volunteer-led, grassroots effort to fight poverty, hunger, and injustice around the world. We make it our mission to educate the community on global campaigns and initiatives that many times are life changing to those with a voice. We have worked on the Green Climate Fund, the refugee crisis, American poultry works, women cocoa farmers, food aid reform, and many many others. We table at local events and concerts, plan our own events, and send communications and requests to legislators and corporations insisting upon better practices and reform. We’re not a stiff group; we try to have fun, but still take our work and efforts very seriously.
10075.title: Volunteer with Action Corps NYC

10268.description: Sanctuary for Families is New York’s leading service provider and advocate for survivors of domestic violence, sex trafficking, and related forms of gender violence. Sanctuary works to end gender violence through three key areas: direct service; outreach, education and training; and systems-change advocacy. Sanctuary currently seeks Hungarian-speaking volunteers to complete written document translations. Sanctuary's volunteer-led Translation Project supports our agency staff by completing a range of written document translations, including legal documents and outreach materials. This opportunity is open to all with written fluency in Hungarian - translations are completed virtually via email. Qualifications: Written fluency in Hungarian Ability to complete translations via email within a set deadline Respect for confidentiality is a must How to Apply To apply, please complete our volunteer application form found on our website (www.sanctuaryforfamilies.org/support-us/volunteer)
10268.title: Hungarian Translator

10285.description: Join the American Heart Association as Volunteer at the Wall Street Run & Heart Walk on May 18th! The American Heart Association is seeking 300volunteers to support the Wall Street Run & Heart Walk on May 18th from 4:00PM to 8:00PM. The NYC Heart Walk, a 5K walk/run, aims to spread lifesaving heart health awareness in New York City. With your support, we can save lives and build healthier communities! Sign up, here: Volunteer Registration Volunteer responsibilities include: cheering, support in the festival area, giving out refreshments, and raising heart health awareness Raffle Prize: Volunteers who sign up before Friday, April 28st (12PM) will be entered to win a raffle prize of an Amazon gift card and an American Heart Association gift. **Groups larger then 15 people will receive special recognition at the Heart Walk and a goody bag. Please feel free to reach out to Justine Kim, Community Relations Director, at Justine.Kim@heart.org with any questions! Thank you for your support Wall Street Run & Heart Walk Date: Thursday, May 18th Time: 4:00PM - 8:00PM Location: American Express Building (Lobby) 200 Vesey Street, New York *T-shirt will be provided* Sign up online to volunteer and invite friends to join you! REGISTER, here! https://aha.formstack.com/forms/wallst_heartwalk
10285.title: Wall Street Run & Heart Walk
10285.org: American Heart Association - New York City

10280.description: WE NEED HELP TO RECOVER SOME DATE NEEDED FOR A DOCUMENTARY PROJECT. THE DISK IS A WD-BRAND; FORMATTED FOR MAC AND PC, AND AT THIS TIME IS ONLY SHOWS A LIGTH BUT DOES NOT BOOT.
10280.title: DATA RECOVERY

10280.description: Come Volunteer as a grade school teacher at our 300 student grade school located in Kabula, Kenya. Volunteer Kenya is a grassroots volunteer organization located in western Kenya. We run 4 humanitarian aid programs: (1) Healthcare, (2) HIV/AIDS Education, (3) Education, (4) Microenterprise Development. Volunteer Kenya / ICODEI is a non-religious, non-political volunteer organization run through a partnership of past overseas volunteers and local Kenyans. Since 1998 we have had over 400 volunteers from around the world participate in our programs. Please visit our website to learn more about our volunteer opportunities www.volunteerkenya.org
10280.title: Volunteer as a Teacher in Africa

10281.description: A 3-mile walk/run designed to engage the New York City corporate and medical communities in an activity that promotes heart health through physical activity, friendly competition, volunteerism, fundraising and fun. The event brings together over 150 of the top companies in New York City and about 12,000 participants. A Festival will take place from 5pm-8pm with the race starting at 6:45 p.m.
10281.title: NYC - Wall Street Run &  Heart Walk

10019.description: The American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division is looking for volunteers to help out at the 2017 Liver Life Walk in New York City! Event duties include: Event Set-up Duties: Assist in hanging banners, setting up tables and chairs, decorating etc. Registration Duties: Welcome participants as they check-in, pick-up their t-shirts and receive detailed information about the day. Parking Attendants Duties: Direct vehicles to empty parking spaces one at a time. There will be an area for volunteers to park separate from participant parking. Also, parking attendants will assist with placing directional signs to designate where the event is being held. Course Set-up Duties: Place route markers and educational signs throughout the walk course approximately every few blocks so walkers/runners are able to stay on the course. Responsibilities also include: 1. Deliver tables, water and cups to water stations 2. Drop-off water station volunteers and course monitors 3. During the Walk, patrol the course to pick-up any tired walkers 4. Follow the final walkers to pick up the course monitors and water stop volunteers 5. Return to the course to pick up the remaining water, cups, tables and signage Course Monitors Duties: As a Course Monitor, you will be stationed at specified intersections along the course to help participants cross any busy intersections and cheer them on to the finish. You might be asked to wear a bright orange vest to distinguish yourself. Greeters Duties: This is every participant's first impression of the event! Greet participants after they have parked and direct them to the registration area. T ent Supervisors Duties: We will be having several tents with food, drinks, games, etc. so we will need people to oversee that everything is going smoothly. We are happy to provide proof of volunteer time for those who need it for schools, community service, etc. If interested, please contact Stefany Arias at sarias@liverfoundation.org.
10019.title: 2017 Liver Life Walk New York City
10019.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

10019.description: The National Chorale is a premier NYC choral organization, founded 49 years ago, made up of an Ensemble of professional singers and soloists. Our annual concert series is presented in David Geffen Hall at Lincoln Center. We also present choral performances in other NYC venues as well as at other local, national and international festivals and music events and conferences. We also have a K-12 music training program where we provide professional music teachers in local NYC public schools. Our Executive Director is underwater with her workload, some of which we would like to offload to Administrative / Clerical Assistants. Work ranges from researching items on the Internet, to answering phones, to preparing reports, to scheduling events and people, to occasionally running an errand, typing - letters and reports and input to our database, attending meetings, communicating with our audience members, Board Members, concert personnel, funders, sponsors and K-12 NYC school administrators and teachers. Folks who have worked in the corporate environment with experienced office skills would be ideal. Office is in midtown Manhattan (Broadway & West 51st Street. Friendly office environment. Prefer a minimum of 20 hours per week, but we will work with you to design a schedule that is comfortable for you. We really need your help and like most nonprofit organizations, cannot afford to hire the support staff we require. BTW, one of the perks for our volunteers is that they are provided with two tickets to every Lincoln Center concert, and more if needed! Come join us and know that you will be making a real impact with a deserving nonprofit organization!
10019.title: Administrative / Clerical Help

10019.description: Encore’s Friendly Visiting Program matches seniors in the community with volunteers who visit them every week to chat and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are based on your availability. There are two seniors new to the Friendly Visiting Program who speak Spanish fluently (and a little bit of English). Be the person who brightens their day and week, and your own! We ask for a minimum commitment of weekly hour-long visits for a period of at least six months. Many of our Friendly Visiting friendships last much longer! Applicants must speak Spanish.
10019.title: Looking for Spanish Speakers for Special Volunteer Opportunities!

10019.description: Every Wednesday, Encore Community Services’ senior center hosts a store that offers clothing, accessories, home goods, and other necessities at very reduced prices. You will be assisting with organizing the displays, money handling, helping seniors look through merchandise, and processing donations. We are seeking a volunteer to help manage the store on a weekly basis. The time commitment we are asking for is every Wednesday from 9am - 1:30pm.
10019.title: Come Join Our Charity Boutique at Encore Community Services

10019.description: Encore Community Services hosts breakfast Monday-Friday every week, open to all seniors. We are looking for a volunteer to help manage the breakfast cart from 8:45am-10am. Duties include helping set up the breakfast cart with food and drink, serving pastries, breakfast sandwiches, coffee and tea, and some light clean up. The mornings are quiet and pleasant at Encore's senior center. Approximately 25-50 seniors come in for breakfast. You will see familiar faces day to day and be a valuable part of our team! We need help on Tuesday and Friday mornings. We are looking for a commitment of 1-4 days per month (Tuesdays, Fridays, or a combination), for a period of at least 6 months.
10019.title: Breakfast = most important meal of the day: Help provide it to seniors in need!

10019.description: You are looking for a meaningful, innovative project to contribute your seasoned, high level executive-level skills. You are a visionary and organizational architect who cares about young people and their potential. \"Purpose\" is a big part of your vocabulary. The idea of re-imagining education is thrilling to you, and you are excited by the idea of jumping headfirst into a creative start up environment with a small team of people who are passionate about the future of education. You would feel a sense of fulfillment in growing an innovative, out-of-the-box education program for high school students, particularly one that has already begun to show immense impact. And last but not least, nothing thrills you more than the opportunity to take on challenges in a start-up environment, and to dig deeply into all aspects of scaling a new program at a pivotal time in its growth. You are looking to commit your time to a cause, not as an outside volunteer but as a co-creator. Is this you? Then read on! Where are we at? Since our inception in 2014, we have reached more than 2,000 students; taught over 17 semester-long credit-bearing classes (The QUESTion Class) with a 95% graduation rate and 93% empowerment rate; and implemented our programs in 3 public schools in the South Bronx, NYC. We are now entering in a new phase, planning to implement a multi-school pilot with 12 schools by 2018 and laying the foundation to scale nationally. Position Description & Responsibilities With your executive-level experience and hands-on skills, you will enable the transition from the Startup to the Scale-Up Phase. You will serve as a dynamic organizational leader, strategic visionary and hands-on executor. In partnership with our Founder and Executive Director, you will: Develop and regularly review our long-term and immediate goals, strategies and plans for growth Ensure the successful execution and iteration of our plans Enable partnerships with allied groups and organizations where there is synergy and potential for scaling (Policy makers, DOE, Charter Networks, Youth organizations, academia and other significant players in the Re-Imagining Education Movement) Build the core elements to support scaling, including but not limited to: Refining the delivery model for large and long term scalability Identifying best Measuring & Evaluation Tools in partnership with academics, business consultants and other SEL organizations to capture and demonstrate data driven results Developing the Teacher Certification Program and the QUESTion Academy Developing a centralized Curriculum Repository/Portal Implementing the systems, processes and procedures needed (Sales Force, financial systems, HR and legal compliance, etc) Strengthen and widen our Fundraising Outreach What will you gain by working with us? Incredible inspiration and creative challenge A pioneering role in re-imagining education First-hand experience of youth wisdom in action A chance to connect with young people in a profound way by exploring core human questions together Love, connectivity, purpose, joy, fulfillment Action packed days and never ending flow of creativity Unleashing your imagination and making the impossible possible
10019.title: Executive Volunteer Position @ an Education Startup

10019.description: We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Looking for a Meaningful Volunteer Experience? Become a Friendly Visitor today!

10019.description: Lighthouse Guild has three health plans through which we manage every medical and healthcare need, especially for those who are visually impaired. We coordinate healthcare, therapy, in-home care and other services so that members can live safely at home. We are looking for a volunteer, who is currently a licensed Registered Nurse in New York State (NYS) who has data entry skills. This volunteer will be responsible for maintaining accuracy of the GuildNet case list on the NYS Department of Health Uniform Assessment System (UAS) website by removing disenrolled members. Principle duties and responsibilities: Review the list of GuildNet monthly disenrollments. Update the UAS system to confirm disenrollments. Qualifications: Current New York State Registered Nurses license, required. Strong computer skills, required. The ability to take and follow instruction, required. Prior experience where computer use was required is necessary. The ability to exhibit excellence in the execution of assigned responsibilities is required. Detail of service opportunity: The ideal candidate is available approximately 8-12 hours during the first or second week of each month, or as long as it takes to complete the assignment. The registered nurse will have to complete on line training in the UAS software system prior to starting the task. There will also be ad hoc training as mandated by the Department of Health.
10019.title: Administrative Nursing Opportunity in NYC

10019.description: Art for Healing NYC Org still has a huge donated art collection for sale at super prices, We also share the funds raised with other charities! Please contact us and visit our website for more information. We need marketing outreach online, so you can live anywhere to help us get the word out. Also when you help us make a big sale we give you a piece of art work as a thank you! Win /win for all.
10019.title: Online marketing outreach about our donated art collection for sale at super low prices!

10019.description: Art for Healing NYC org is in need of someone who likes doing art inventory, at the gallery. Also marketing outreach of our donated art works for sale, and sharing with other charities. After helping 20 hours total, you recieve a FREE pice of art work from a super collection we have!
10019.title: Inventory of our Donated Art works,  history book archiving, share art sales with other charities

10019.description: Make a Difference. Graphic Design Internship at ClassWish.org! Work in NYC or Virtually We are recruiting outstanding graphic design students as interns for late Summer 2012 and the 2012-2013 school year (either or both!) to collaborate on the boldest nonprofit initiative we know. We are looking for passionate, energetic students with exceptional skills to create web page layouts, flyers, logos, etc. for ClassWish.org. This is an outstanding leadership opportunity in an innovative start-up nonprofit organization. Here is the problem we are tackling: K-12 schools in this country do not have enough resources to let children explore their potential and excel. Art supplies, books, computers, musical instruments, science equipment, sports equipment, and even paper for computers and printers are all in desperately short supply. Our Approach: ClassWish . org, an exciting new nonprofit, uses modern business practices and the latest marketing techniques to help 125,000 schools serving 56 million kids, inform, inspire and engage supporters. Teachers visit the site to create Wish Lists of the resources they need. People in the community can see exactly what is needed and contribute to help. About Us: The people behind ClassWish.org include such prominent education and business leaders as Adam Hirsch, former COO, Mashable; Laurie Coots, CMO, TBWA; Scott Cutler, EVP, New York Stock Exchange; Betsy Morgan, former CEO, Huffington Post; Nancy Pelz-Paget, Director, Education and Society Program, Aspen Institute; Sharon Robinson, CEO, American Association of Colleges of Teacher Education. Forbes Magazine liked our approach so much that they donated a full page to help raise awareness. Yo-Yo Ma, Tony Hawk and Dwight Howard are among the celebrities who have offered to help promote ClassWish.org. The work: Teachers and students are already getting supplies from ClassWish.org. Now, we need to develop attention-grabbing graphics so we can help more kids. You will take a leadership role and work with other highly motivated interns, established professionals, and directly with our co-founder. What do we offer? You will enhance your portfolio with projects that will be displayed on the Internet as well as in print, visible to potential future employers, and you will have the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped children get the tools they need to perform at their best. If you want to gain great experience and do something you will always be proud of, send a cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org. Impress us. This is competitive. FAQ Is this a business or a nonprofit? ClassWish is a nonprofit, but we use the latest techniques from the business world to make a leveraged, scalable and financially-self sustaining difference in the lives of tens of millions of children. This sounds ambitious! Daniel Burnham, the great Chicago architect, said \"Make no little plans; they have not the power to stir men’s souls.\" (Nor women’s, we hasten to add). Little plans also do not have the power to provide a better education to 56 million kids who deserve more than they are getting today. We face a crushing need in schools, have a solid plan to address it, and with your help, we intend to grow this very large and very fast. Where are you located? We are in Manhattan, conveniently located right across from Madison Square Garden. There are four express subway stops within one block. We will also hire interns to work remotely from other cities. I looked at your site and have some suggestions. Great! This is a collaborative project, and we want to hear from you. Is this a paid internship? We can offer a great experience, a great addition to your portfolio, academic credit (if your school allows), stunning recommendations, and a chance to make a difference, but we are a start-up nonprofit, so can only offer unpaid internship and volunteer positions. When will you select the interns? We’re agile. When we see a great candidate, we extend an invitation immediately. We won’t keep you waiting for a decision. What dates will the internship run? We are hiring for the spring semester, for the summer, and beyond. Tell us what you are looking for. What are the hours? We welcome full-time and part-time interns. Let us know what works for you. What will I need to bring? Brains, heart, passion, energy, a notebook computer, and a passion to make an immediate improvement to the education of tens of millions of children. Sounds exciting! How can I apply? Please send an impressive cover letter and a resume to interns @ ClassWish . org.
10019.title: Make a Difference.   Graphic Design Internship at ClassWish.org!

10019.description: The Chad Foundation is seeking volunteer cardiologists, ultrasound echo technicians and nurses to help provide cardiovascular screenings for young athletes and students in the 5 boroughs of NY to help prevent Sudden Cardiac Death by identifying structural heart anomalies such as HCM (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy), the leading silent killer of SCD in young athletes and premature cardiovascular risk factors such as hypertension, high cholesterol, obesity and diabetes. Thanks to the donated services of cardiologists from some of the leading hospitals in the country such as \"Childrens Hospital Los Angeles,\" \"Childrens National Medical Center,\" Wash. D.C., \"Johns Hopkins Medical Center,\" Baltimore, and \"Columbia Presbyterian,\" NYC, Chad has provided overr 6,000 echocardiograms to young athletes and students in 5 states and abroad in Austria and Sweden (16 and 26 countries of athletes participating in the \"1st and 2nd Homeless Streetsoccer World Cups.\") Thanks to recent grants, we are expanding our heart screenings to include tests for cholesterol and diabetes in youth utilizing state-of-the-art Cholestech machines. In a recent pilot study, Chad and the Living Heart screened 250 high school students in Holyoke, MA and found one-third were at risk for hypertension, high cholesterol, diabetes, obesity and/or structural abnormalities. Also, we are glad to tell you, Johns Hopkins Heart Hype Program, will house collected data from Chad screenings for future research. Typically, a Chad screening is held on a Saturday, for 4 or 5 hours at a school gym or community center, often honouring a child who succumbed to Sudden Cardiac Death or a survivor, who through preventive screenings, is alive and thriving with appropriate medical treatment and lifestyle change. Ultrasound manufacturers donate their latest portable ultrasound equipment for the events. We invite you to visit our website, www.chadfoundation.org to view the \"Chad Preventive Heart Screenings\" in action. Thank you.
10019.title: Volunteer Cardiologists, Echo Technicians and Nurses Needed
10019.org: The Chad Foundation for Athletes and Artists

10018.description: Susan G. Komen and Manduka are excited to invite you to project:OM’s marquee event in New York City. Please join us Thursday, May 11th at 6:00 pm in Bryant Park to be part of project:OM, the world’s largest yoga class of one million bodies strong. https://www.facebook.com/events/422609994766291/?notif_t=plan_user_joined?if_id=1493226802057360
10018.title: Om for the Cure

10018.description: Global Green is seeking help from a reseacher to support our Solar for Sandy initiative. Global Green has built the first two resilient renewable projects at community centers in areas impacted by Super Storm Sandy, including the first solar + battery project in NYC at the Red Hook Recreation Center. See video here for more background: Solar for Sandy project https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=281Xbww9D-E We're in the process of building four more projects. Global Green is seeking help from a volunteer to help us model new options for building additional projects that include exisitng solar and battery incentives in New York and New Jersey. Volunteers with a background in engineering, financial modeling and/or economics research are welcome. Above all, this research takes a combination of persistence and analytical curiousity.
10018.title: Researcher Needed for Solar Resiliency Initiative
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Global Green has built two pioneering solar resiliency projects in New York City, including the first solar + battery project at a New York City community center. The project is at the Red Hook Recreation Center in Brooklyn and featured in this video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=281Xbww9D-E Following our education and demonstration programs, we're seeking to advise other commuity centers how they can adopt similar programs. Global Green is seeking help from a researcher to model a) incentives b) demand charges and other factors to see where and how solar resiliency programs can be cost effective for community centers to adopt similar programs.
10018.title: Energy Markets Researcher Needed for Solar Resiliency at Community Centers
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Global Green NY is looking for volunteers to help with our food donation work this summer. Volunteer opportunities are for food donation pick-ups in Midtown Manhattan on weekday nights (during typical resutrant closing time), where food will then be transported to food banks and shelters for those in need. http://www.globalgreen.org/getinvolved/ Ideally volunteers: For food rescue volunteers, the only qualifications are that they are punctual, reliable and able to carry 20+ lbs of food.
10018.title: New York GGUSA Volunteer

10018.description: Global Green is a national non-profit organization (globalgreen.org). In our New York City office, we're seeking help in copy editing our articles, reports and on-line communications related to food waste recovery and solar resiliency. We're seeking help from a professional in communications, journalism or related fields who can copy edit 2-3 of our materials prior to external publications. Volunteers will be given a defined project to work on with a maximum of 10-20 hours of work. Interested volunteers who want to go beyond copy editing are welcome to publish their own work as a guest author on our blog. This work can be done remotely. NYC region volunteers are preferred so that an initial meeting can happen in person. We welcome return volunteers who are interested in contributing on a regular basis or a couple times per year.
10018.title: Copy Editor Needed for Environmental Non-profit reports and communications
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Looking for a rewarding and challenging opportunity to help those in our community affected by Huntington's disease? Join us in the Huntington's Disease Society of America National Office in mid-town Manhattan! We are looking for individuals to help us with calls, mailings, donation/sponosorship packets, assemble kits, send emails, and other various office type duties. This opportunity is available to any ages 15 and older during our normal buisness hours (Mon - Fri 9am - 5pm). We are focused on ending this fatal genetic disorder and with your help this can become a reality for so many in our community! Join us today!!
10018.title: Huntington's Disease National Office Volunteer

10018.description: Product Donation Volunteer Post The New York Product Donation Volunteer supports the GOOD+ Foundation’s mission of providing essential clothing, gear and services to low-income families. This individual will do so by sorting and screening through incoming product donations, helping to maintain the organization’s inventory, and assisting the Donations/Volunteer Program Assistant. Responsibilities include: Screening and sorting incoming Individual Product Donations. Ensuring that all gear, such as strollers and highchairs have not been recalled before storing away for donation. Clean all baby gear and put them away. Help to maintain organization of the warehouse. Process incoming donations into our inventory system with the use of mobile application, Canvas. Assist the Donation & Volunteer Program Assistant with volunteer groups and donations. Skills and Experience: Responsible, reliable, hard-working, detail-oriented and comfortable standing for long periods of time. Self-motivated and able to work independently, while also collaborating in a team setting. Great attitude and ability to pick up new information quickly, while taking direction and guidance well. Knowledge of children’s product is a plus! Motivation to make a difference! Reporting : This role will report directly to the Donations & Volunteer Assistant If interested, send an email to Kelly at Kelly@goodplusfoundation.org.
10018.title: Product Donation Volunteer

10018.description: The Latinas On the Verge of Excellence, L.O.V.E., Mentoring Program supports and empowers young Latinas to strive both in school and life through positive role modeling. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program aims to enhance academic performance and high school graduation rates among young Latinas with the support of positive role models who believe in their inner power and are committed to help them achieve their full potential. The L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program is currently looking for an intern who will collaborate with the development and implementation of the program. The future intern will perform her activities in partner high schools. The intern will work 15 hours per week. L.O.V.E. Intern responsibilities Supports with L.O.V.E. mentors recruiting process Helps plan and implement L.O.V.E. mentoring sessions Maintains records of mentees academic progress Keeps accurate records of mentors and mentees Assists in conducting L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program evaluations Maintains and develops L.O.V.E. social media platforms Communicates effectively, verbally, and in writing with L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program Director Qualifications University female student GPA: 3.0 and above Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Creative capacity Strong organizational, project management and presentation skills Be proficient in Word and Excel Be available a minimum of 15 hours per week Commit to work for the organization for a semester
10018.title: L.O.V.E. Mentoring Program - Internship Position
10018.org: LATINAS ON THE VERGE OF EXCELLENCE LOVE INC

10018.description: We're seeking immediate help from a graphic design professional to support visualization and communication of data from a report on our food waste composting and pilot programs conducted at 10 multi-family buildings in 2015. The project is unique in that we included messaging to residents on both composting and food scrap reduction. We'd like help with graphic design that can help show: a) how the results vary by building and building type b) what was the impact of our food waste reduction messaging?
10018.title: Data Visualization Volunteer Needed for Food Waste Report
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

10018.description: Sing for Hope transforms and uplifts individuals and communities by mobilizing artists in volunteer service, bringing the power of the arts to those who need it most. Our programs include collaborative concerts for hospital patients, after-school arts classes for NYC youth, and our flagship initiative, The Sing for Hope Pianos. SFH Project Leaders make it possible for us to bring to life our mission of \"art for all.\" By leading Sing for Hope's programming at hospitals, veterans centers, community organizations and more, Project Leaders provide a critical link between our Artist Partners and on-site staff at partner organizations, and ensure high-quality experiences for all involved. Project Leaders are vital to Sing for Hope's ability to bring the arts to as many New Yorkers as possible. As a Project Leader we ask you to: Collaborate with Sing for Hope staff to plan program content for upcoming sessions Coordinate Sing for Hope programs at our partner sites, welcome and guide Volunteer Artists, and set a warm and positive tone throughout each program Serve as point of contact for VAs and site staff during programs, problem-solving as necessary Communicate with Sing for Hope as needed during and following programs Report back by sharing photos, quotes, and metrics with Sing for Hope staff via online surveys/email As a Project Leader, you will: Commit to a minimum of 2 hours of volunteer service a month for 6 months Complete the SFH Project Leader Training module (half day workshop) in August or September Attend your pre-determined scheduled programs (SFH programs take place during the daytime, evenings, or on weekends) As a Project Leader, you'll benefit by: Gaining invaluable, on-the-ground leadership experience Building your resume Meeting an amazing array of terrific Volunteer Artists Receiving ongoing feedback, support, and professional development Helping uplift individuals and communities Qualifications Must be 18 or older Strong public speaking, facilitation, and communication skills Personable, flexible, proactive, and comfortable solving problems as needed Basic technology skills (ie photography on camera or smartphone, email, online survey) Artistic ability is a plus, but not required Background check as required by partner organizations \"Being a Sing for Hope Project Leader gives the chance to offer kindness and love to those in circumstances that are often beyond our realm of understanding. It's a great responsibility, but an even greater privilege. I discovered almost immediately that I was able to dig much deeper into myself than I thought was possible. I discovered a kind of selfless love inside myself, a kindness that I didn't know I had. Being a Project Leader is a gift.\" - Abby Powell, Sing for Hope Project Leader
10018.title: BE PART OF THE ART! Become a Sing for Hope Project Leader

10018.description: BCAGlobal, a diversity nonprofit in the culinary arts, is recruiting for one or two interns for school credit and travel/lunch stipend. Duties range from office organization, data management, and assisting in general program implementation. Opportunities for more substantive projects including marketing, social media campaigns, and grant/policy writing will also be available. Seeking interns who are happy to learn and are looking to add value to the organization through reliable, hard work a couple days a week for a few hours. School credit will be given!
10018.title: DIVERSITY NON-PROFIT INTERNSHIP, CULINARY ARTS (School Credit & Stipend)

10018.description: Sing for Hope’s Artist Partner Roster lies at the core of our mission and features artists from almost every artistic discipline--actors, singers, musical theater performers, classical and jazz instrumentalists, dancers, and more. Working in tandem with our dedicated staff, our roster of artists gives back to local communities, donating their time and talent. Our Artist Partners are the engines that power our broad range of arts outreach programs, inspiring and fostering positive change for those in need.
10018.title: Share Your Art: Become a Sing for Hope Artist Partner!

10018.description: The Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF) is looking for dedicated and enthusiastic young professionals, concerned about America’s education system and passionate about CSF’s mission, to join our Young Leaders Board. Despite recent education reforms, demand for CSF scholarships remains extremely high and is only growing. As we strive to serve this demand, CSF seeks to identify and cultivate the next generation of leaders committed to our continued success. A key to this effort is the Young Leaders Board, which works closely with CSF staff to grow the Young Leaders program and build awareness about CSF. Children’s Scholarship Fund (CSF): CSF aims to maximize educational opportunity for all children: for those in need by offering tuition assistance in grades K-8 for alternatives to faltering conventional schools, and for all children by supporting and cultivating education reform and parental choice efforts. Young Leaders Board: CSF Young Leaders Board seeks to maximize educational opportunities for all children by supporting CSF’s mission through a network of young professionals in NYC. The Young Leaders Board assists in fundraising, volunteer activities, and spreading awareness of CSF’s brand and objectives. Please contact Jane Lee at jlee@scholarshipfund.org for more information!
10018.title: Children's Scholarship Fund Seeking Young Leaders Board Members

10038.description: Walk event with food, games, entertainment and informational tables for about 800 participants. There is a large festival celebration to kick-off the actual walk over the Brooklyn Bridge! DATE: May 16 th, 2016 - Pier 16 at the South Street Seaport - NYC Estimated Ask for Volunteers: 90-100 people Set-up 11:00AM-5:30PM Festival 5:00PM-8:00PM Walk Route & Spirit Crew 6:00PM-9:30PM Event Breakdown 7:30PM-9:30PM Finish Area Breakdown 8:30PM-9:30PM Times and responsibilities subject to change. Responsibilities: Set-up - 11:00AM-5:30PM Aide with unloading the supplies and materials Arrange boxes in proper tents/area & position barricades around event Aide with set-up & decorating for event Arrange balloons, hang banners, set-up tables and other decorations Assist hanging event signage Set-up display materials in information tents Assist vendors get their materials and tents set-up Troubleshoot festival kick-off to ensure all set-up is complete Festival - 5:00PM-8:00PM Arrive before festival kick-off to learn layout and get into assigned activity which can include: Assist with KID ZONE tent Monitor and facilitate children activities including face painting, games,and various other activities Assist at the banner & sign making tent Act as \"walk route guides\" along the walk route cheering and guiding walkers along the way! Help distribute T-shirts and incentives Help distribute food in food tent and/or VIP catered tent Help distribute informational materials from Mission Tent Help usher participants from Registration/Check-in Tent into the festival Mediate the GI Doctor Tent with visitors and questions Walk Route & Spirit Crew 6:00PM-9:30PM Event Breakdown 7:30PM-9:30PM Finish Area Breakdown 8:30PM-9:30PM Upon arrival, you will be helping to aid in wrapping-up the activities of the festival. Once all participants leave for the Walk, all stations begin to get broken down Rented tables, chairs, etc need to be grouped together for pick-up. Bins, boxes and materials need to be loaded into rental truck. All signs, balloons, trash need to be collected and properly either packed or thrown away. Leftover food must be ushered to the front table for distribution to returning walkers and then after the last participant returns the food will be the last thing loaded into the truck for delivery. There will be a separate finish line area - participants begin to return back from the walk route around and your purpose will be to welcome back the walkers across the \"finish-line\" by cheering them on and giving them a feeling of team \"spirit!\" Overall, this is a very fun event to get involved with! You can sign up for one or all of the available times! If you have any further questions or would like more detailed information please feel free to call the Take Steps Administrative Assistant, Chad Gneiting, at 646-388-9283 or email cgneitingtemp@crohnscolitisfoundation.org
10038.title: 2017 NYC Take Steps for Crohn’s & Colitis
10038.org: Crohn's & Colitis Foundation - Greater NY Chapter

10038.description: Join the American Lung Association as we raise awareness and funds to fight against lung cancer and for lung health. Together, we are a FORCE to be reckoned with. The American Lung Association is recruiting volunteers to help at the upcoming Lung Force Walk on Saturday, May 20, 2017. The event will be at South Street Seaport, Pier 16 New York, NY 10038. You can volunteer anywhere from 7:30 am until approximately 2:30 pm. We are unable to have a successful event without volunteers like you. Please reach out to me if you have any questions or concerns. Did you know? Lung cancer is the #1 cancer killer in America, and most people aren’t aware. Anyone can get it - if you have lungs, you can get lung cancer, and it’s on the rise in women. More than 33 million Americans suffer from asthma, COPD (which includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis), and other lung diseases.
10038.title: NYC Lung Force Walk

10038.description: We are looking for volunteers with dance experience to help run a weekly movement-based creative workshop for students with intellectual disabilities in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn, Wednesdays from 11-12. This opportunity takes place over 12 weeks, for a small group of middle and high school students. The workshop will culminate with an informal showing. We are also looking for volunteer yoga instructors in all boroughs.
10038.title: Looking for Dance Teachers and Yoga Instructors

10038.description: Community center in Chinatown in Manhattan desperately needs a makeover to make our students smile. We provide the paint, rollers and everything else and you are the painters. Looking for some amateur painting experience and neat workers. Mural artists are welcome too.
10038.title: Paint smiles on the faces of our students by painting our classrooms

10038.description: Habitat for Humanity is seeking to fill 100+ AmeriCorps positions in communities across the United States. These are full time (paid) service opportunities that range from 10 ½ - 12 months. As a Habitat AmeriCorps Member, you will receive a monthly living allowance, paid leave time, and access to other benefits. Members begin service in January and February 2017. What We Do Everyone deserves a decent place to live. Here at Habitat, we build strength, stability, and self-reliance through shelter. We believe in providing access to decent and affordable housing, partnering with future Habitat homeowners to create a decent and affordable place to call home. What You’ll Do As a Habitat AmeriCorps member, you will be placed in one of our 100+ communities supported by our local Habitat affiliates. You will use your passion and commitment to service to meet the needs of our Habitat affiliates by engaging communities, building capacity, and increasing productivity. There are many individualized roles to choose from, so finding one that utilizes your strengths and unique skillset should be pretty easy. We offer roles ranging from construction to volunteer management to project development. Minimum Requirements 18 years of age or older U.S. citizen, national, or lawful permanent resident Possess a high school diploma or GED equivalent (or agree to work towards one while serving) Length Positions terms range from 46 ½ weeks (Direct Service roles) to 52 weeks (Indirect Service roles.) Living Allowance $980 to $1,329 per month AmeriCorps Education Award This position is eligible for an AmeriCorps education award upon successful completion of the program. Value of education award is $5,775 (pre-tax) Position Start Dates January/February 2017 If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, we’d love to connect with you. For more information and individual listings, visit: www.habitat.org/americorps.
10038.title: Habitat for Humanity AmeriCorps Positions – New York, NY
10038.org: Habitat for Humanity International - Atlanta, GA

10038.description: The Events volunteer will report to and work closely with the Annual Giving & Special Projects Manager and the Resource Development team to plan, execute and manage the logistics around fundraising events. This volunteer position also requires the planning and execution of non-fundraising events including groundbreakings and home dedications. We are looking for a candidate who can focus specifically on building a structure for annual events as well as bring creative ideas to each project. Assist in the planning and execution of our annual fundraising event, The Habitat House Party Assist in the planning and execution of new events that will help cultivate new donors and sustain Habitat New York City contacts with existing donors and other key stakeholders. Such events include special build days like Broadway Builds, Women Build and more. Assist in the planning and execution of organization-wide events, including but not limited to groundbreakings, home dedications, and family and volunteer recognition events. Coordinate logistics for corporate team build days. Assist in Manage creative programming, operations, logistics, production, budgeting, contracts, billing and result reporting for all events. Create a working calendar of special events and a timeline for planning each even which includes budgets. Assist the Grants and In-Kind Manager in soliciting Gifts-in-Kind donations and sponsorships as needed for events. Work with the Communications and Marketing team to create event collateral and marketing materials for each event, as needed. Assist in the preparation for events including correspondence, invitations, guest lists, mailings, vendor approvals, ticketing, auction items, marketing materials and more. Continuously stays abreast of event strategies, ideas and trends in the marketplace including competitive and industry brands. Utilizes this knowledge to create opportunities and inform all facets of events Required Skills and Qualifications: Minimum 1-2 years event planning/event management experience specifically in New York City. College/University experience applies. Strong organizational and planning skills and the ability to think strategically and creatively. This includes database and budget management. Strong customer service including clients, donors, volunteers and vendors. Must be able to take direction, think creatively and proactively suggest solutions, and be able to prioritize tasks. Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and presentation skills. Able to work nights and weekends as necessary. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Ability to lift 30lbs. Passion and understanding of the Habitat for Humanity mission and the desire to promote it!
10038.title: Events Volunteer
10038.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

10038.description: The Next Chapter Book Club (NCBC) is an innovative community-based reading program for adolescents and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities. The NCBC network includes more than 2,000 members meeting weekly since 2002 at nearly 300 book clubs in 31 states, four Canadian provinces, and three European countries. NCBC is the largest community-based book club program for adolescents and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities in the world. It is an opportunity to maintain reading and literacy skills beyond school. Volunteers: We are looking for leaders to commit to one hour weekly, 11-12 or 12-1 any weekday, in the Bronx, Upper West Side, and Upper East Side, for a minimum of 14 weeks.
10038.title: Next Chapter Book Club (NCBC)
