10016.description: ELEM/Youth in Distress in Israel is seeking new members for our new Young Professional Leadership Board. We are seeking volunteers who are passionate about our mission to transform the lives of troubled youth in Israel. The purpose of this board will be to: Raise awareness of ELEM’s work; Develop and support fundraising strategies; Assist in event planning. Time requirement is flexible, with meetings held in the NY midtown office when necessary (not more than once a month). Each prospective board member volunteer will be considered based on interest, experience, and what he or she feels they could bring to ELEM. If you are passionate about the cause and wish to be part of ELEM’s amazing team, please email Liora Attias at attias@elem.org and put \"ELEM Young Professional Leadership Board\" as the subject line. To learn more about ELEM's work and other volunteer opportunities visit www.elem.org
10016.title: Young Professional Leadership Board
10016.org: E L E M YOUTH IN DISTRESS INC

10016.description: The position is for 8-16 hours per week in the office during business hours. The choice of hours is flexible to be negotiated with the supervisor. Note the office is closed on major Jewish holidays. Our USA office promotes brand awareness and fundraising for our clinical work on the ground in Israel. The following is our description of our work in Israel: Founded in 1982, ELEM/Youth in Distress in Israel is the country’s leading nonprofit organization dedicated to treating and transforming the lives of troubled youth. ELEM’s 280 professionals and more than 1,700 volunteers don't wait for referrals to treat these youth, but seek them out on their turf -- on the streets, in schools, on the Internet and at bars and nightclubs. The 25,000 young people we serve annually and the additional 100,000 youth who reach out to ELEM online each year face tremendous challenges, such as: domestic violence, substance abuse, neglect, bullying, homelessness and prostitution. ELEM works with secular and religious Jews; Christian and Muslim Arabs including Bedouins; immigrants, including those from the Former Soviet Union and Ethiopia; and the LGBTQ community. Many live on the streets and most of them will not seek help from traditional social service groups. Our 78 programs in 43 cities provide counseling, mentoring, vocational training and a safe space for Israeli youth to envision a positive future for themselves and become productive members of Israeli society. For more information www.ELEM.org Responsibilities include; research for foundations, donors, organizations and synagogues, organizing events and participating in solicitation. Requirements include excellent writing skills in English; your own laptop computer with MS Word Outlook and PowerPoint. Proficient Hebrew skills and an Israel experience would be an advantage. To apply, submit a cover letter and resume to Liora Attias at:Attias@ELEM.org This position will give a wide experience of the Jewish community and will teach practical skills of fundraising and development.
10016.title: fundraising and development Volunteer
10016.org: E L E M YOUTH IN DISTRESS INC

10016.description: Required Skills: Windows OS, Linux FTP, WinSCP Web Development and CMS - specifically Drupal 7, we want to use bootstrap for reflexivity. good to have, but not a must: SQL (MySQL, MS SQL, Oracle, Access, NaviCat), ASP.Net, PHP, JavaScipt, TypeScript, JSON, CSS Web Development and Database Urgently needed: Web Developer responsible for designing, coding and modifying website module, from layout to function according to Left Forum’ specifications in drupal 7. Patching Drupal and CiviCRM security vulnerabilities Testing, maintenance and troubleshooting of existing Left Forum sites Would be nice when we get this done to: Create and maintain software documentation Integrate data from various back-end services and databases Custom programming and web application development for Drupal Contributing ideas and efforts towards internal projects and working as part of a team to find solutions on various problems Knowledge with source control systems such as Subversion, Drush and SSH with LF Sites. JavaScripts, JSON, Typescripts creation and implementation for Website, InDesign, etc. Database management with Drupal and CiviCRM API Improvements to CiviCRM’s code architecture
10016.title: Website Development Drupal 7

10016.description: Volunteer Position Description: Left Forum is looking for volunteers who have experience and interest in graphic design. We seek creative, skilled individuals interested in helping design featured graphics, flyers, banner ads, website graphics and content, and conference and event program guides as well as possibly helping to design imagery for merchandise. Left Forum engages hundreds of artists every year who bring their ideas and work to share with thousands of other conference and event participants. This volunteer opportunity taps into this and other creative communities of the graphic arts, and engages the artistry of editing and content production. We’re a small organization with a dedicated group of organizers, staff and volunteers with a passion for social justice, community organizing, and progressive change. Located in the CUNY Graduate Center, you’ll be working in an interesting (and very relaxed) office where you’ll interact, meet, and learn from scholars, activists, authors and artists in a rewarding intellectual political milieu. Primary Responsibilities * Help design brand images and a logo * Design posters, flyers, banner ads, website graphics and more. * Help design and brainstorm web content and layout, social media content, press-media content, and all Public Relations content * Help produce the conference program guide utilizing InDesign * Long term possibilities of web design or graphic design projects * Help design and collect \"lefty\" images, memes, etc. (with a focus on various content areas such as: environment, labor, feminism, LGBTQ issues, race and class, etc.) for use on social media, email blast communications, website, and merchandise. Background and Desired Experience * Experience with InDesign, Illustrator Photoshop, and other design and publishing software (for Graphic Designers and Editors), html knowledge preferred * High level of attention to detail and seeing projects through to their completion * Ability to prioritize and handle a variety of projects simultaneously * Ability to work effectively both individually and in a team * Interest in grassroots organizing and social justice About Volunteering This specific volunteer position, while could benefit from in office time and brainstorm, can be carried out in large part, remotely. We also ask for a minimum of a three month commitment though this would ideally be a position that would last through the conference (which will be June 2 - 4, 2017) as projects will certainly arise on a rolling basis from now until then. This volunteer opportunity can begin immediately. If interested or if you have any questions please email: ashley@leftforum.org or volunteer@leftforum.org
10016.title: Left Forum Graphic Design Volunteers Needed

10016.description: This opportunity is available daily from 5:30 PM-6 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue leftover pastries from a cafe in Rose Hill that would otherwise have been thrown away and bring it to those who need it the most! This food will be delivered on-foot to a nearby homeless shelter. Lightweight: the average amount of food is a total of 15 lbs.
10016.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 5:30PM-6PM Daily Food Rescue Events!

10016.description: Action Corps is seeking new volunteers for with concert outreach with Oxfam! We believe that music can change the world. Do you? If so, it’s time to make some noise. Join our network of volunteers and spread the word at concerts in your community. Through Oxfam's strong connection with musicians, labels, managers and media, we have reached out to 100,000's of music fans around the country to spread Oxfam's work and take action to end poverty, hunger and injustice. What does it include: Day of volunteering involves arriving at the venue approximately 45 minutes prior to doors opening. You will set up a table with Oxfam materials and canvass the crowd for signatures on Oxfam's current campaign before the show and between music sets. Training will be offered prior to your first show. Perks: Free access to the show. Oxfam swag like t-shirts, bandanas, etc Opportunities for special or signed merch for the bands for most signatures collected. Perferred access to volunter at special shows as they come up the more you volunteer. More rewards opportunities to come! Bands and Festivals We Table At: Angelique Kidjo Arctic Monkeys Ben Sollee Bloc Party Cat Power Coldplay David Wax Museum DJ Shadow Dirty Heads Editors Explosions in the Sky Fitz and The Tantrums Floggin Molly LCD Soundsystem Lucius The New Pornographers Neko Case OK GO Ra Ra Riot Radiohead State Radio Thao & the Get Down Stay Down The Breeders Tune-yards TV on the Radio Wilco Bonnaroo (TN) Global Citizens Festival (NYC 2015) Lollapalooza (Chicago) Outside Lands (San Francisco) Find out more about Oxfam's Music outreach here: https://www.oxfamamerica.org/explore/inside-oxfam-america/ambassadors/musicians/ More About Action Corps: Nine years ago, Oxfam America founded the Oxfam Action Corps as a global advocate for those who weren’t being heard. The Oxfam Action Corps aimed to right the wrongs of poverty, hunger, and injustice. Oxfam Action Corps embodied the campaigns and efforts of Oxfam America’s work. Our volunteer organizers across the United States have lobbied our elected officials in nationwide efforts, campaigned in our communities for international food companies to improve their policies, an ... d canvassed to educate and empower. Hundreds of lobby visits were conducted, tens of thousands of signatures were collected, and over twenty campaigns were championed, all culminating in an unstoppable momentum of people power. Equally important are the relationships fostered through our efforts. As we grew our networks, we strengthened our forces to mobilize for human rights. Recently Oxfam announced that in response to changing global realities, Oxfam is restructuring internationally, which means the end of the official Oxfam Action Corps program; however, we the volunteers and grassroots organizers choose to continue and expand upon our work under a new a banner: Action Corps. We choose to persevere and continue our mission. As we embark on this new chapter, we commit to creating positive change in our world and believe we can end poverty in our lifetime regardless of the challenges we may face. We ask each of you to continue to stand for global economic justice and the human right to food. Whatever your background, career, ethnicity, gender, join us in our mission -- We are Action Corps. \"Small acts, when multiplied by millions of people, can transform the world.\" Howard Zinn
10016.title: Concert Outreach with Oxfam

10016.description: For over 28 years, the Volunteer Referral Center has helped thousands of New Yorkers find great volunteer opportunities. Through personal, one-on-one interviews, we can match your interests, skills, and availability with a non-profit that needs your help. We work with over 275 non-profits in NYC. Best of all, our services are always FREE! Call for your interview appointment: (212) 889-4805 or sign-up at: http://volunteer-referral.com/ready-to-volunteer-in-nyc-lets-go/
10016.title: Want to Volunteer in NYC? We Can Help You.

10016.description: CARE FOR THE HOMELESS (CFH) needs YOUR help planning the 5th Annual Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show in October 2017! Join the Planning Committee in creating \"the most inspiring fashion show of the year\", which includes a gourmet food reception, signature mocktails, live entertainment and raffle prizes! All funds raised will go to Susan's Place, CFH's 200-bed shelter for mentally ill and medically frail homeless women in the Bronx. THE MODELS of the night are the women from Susan’s Place, where they are invited to a professional casting call, fitting, and a full makeup and hair treatment before the Show. Participating in the show and the funds raised give these women the confidence to lift themselves out of poverty and the resources to start new lives. SUSAN'S PLACE is more than just a shelter for the residents. Through counseling, goal-setting, educational and cultural activities, personal development and healthcare, the residents at Susan’s Place are offered opportunities to work toward independence again. THE SHOW FEATURES Producer Traveling Trousseau and high-end and up-and-coming designers. Past designers have included Demestiks NYC, Shirley + Alice Vintage & Indie designer boutique, Monif C. Plus Size, JustFab Shoes, Seychelles Footware,NYU fashion design student Madeline Dolgin and many more. With YOUR help on our Planning Committee we can help women be back on the path to independence and stability. Together we will work on several aspects of the event, including the following: Event planning (decor and event logistics) Styling (fashion design) Promotion (social media and press) Donation requests (gift bags and raffle items) And more! Visit the CBS link below to learn more about the Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show: http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2016/10/13/bronx-homeless-fashion-show/ Contact us if interested in attending our meetings at 30 East 33rd Street, Floor 5 New York, NY (Dates: 4/27, 5/25, 6/22, 7/27. 8/24 at 6:00 pm).
10016.title: Volunteer for the Health Empowered Beauty Fashion Show!

10016.description: 80% of our volunteer force is made up of women. Without them, our volunteer program would not exist. Starting this year, we want to make special effort for our kids to see more male role models when they come to our Reading Parties. With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older), who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we dive into reading in pairs or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during business hours from Tuesday-Friday. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out Pajama Program's website or email Najamah Abdullah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest!
10016.title: Be a Male Role Model for Children in Need!

10016.description: City Harvest offers volunteer-taught nutrition education courses for people of all ages across NYC. Our programs, including cooking demonstrations and classes, teach participants how to prepare healthy, delicious meals on a budget. Volunteers will receive a 3-hour training to prepare you to teach good nutrition and healthy cooking skills. No prior certification or professional experience is required - just an interest in cooking and healthy eating! Lend your skills and help New Yorkers live a healthier lifestyle.
10016.title: Cook for Good!

10016.description: When City Harvest was founded in 1982, it was run entirely by volunteers who connected a handful of neighborhood restaurants to food programs serving those in need. Now, more than 30 years later, City Harvest volunteers remain a critical part of our food rescue operations and our comprehensive Healthy Neighborhoods programming. Whether you are a member of your company’s volunteer team at Mobile Markets, teach one of our nutrition education courses, or help with mailings and data entry in the office - your time and passion are important resources in the fight against hunger. We offer a wide variety of individual and group volunteer opportunities - including our Nutrition Education Program, Mobile Markets, Greenmarket Rescues, Corporate Repacks, Office Projects, and Food Drives. If you haven't volunteered with us before, please sign up for one of our New Volunteer Orientations held bi-monthly at our NYC office.
10016.title: Volunteer with City Harvest!

10016.description: If you have an interest in healthcare, have computer skills, enjoy research, reading about the various professions within the healthcare field, then working in the hospital's medical library is the ideal place to volunteer. Volunteer in our medical library and assist with helping to research programs, and on-line resources, which would benefit the individuals utilizing the Medical Library. The days and hours for volunteers are flexible Monday-Friday. Prior Library experience would be helpful, but is not a requirment. If you have time to volunteer between 8:00 AM-5:00 PM come to Bellevue.
10016.title: Medical Library

10016.description: With Pajama Program, you will make a positive difference in your community and in a child's life. During our 70 minute Reading Parties, you will provide a child in need with the one on one story time that they rarely experience. We invite volunteers (18 or older) from a range of diverse backgrounds and ethnicities, who have completed our volunteer application and passed our background check, to share their love of reading with the children we serve in NYC. Our Reading Parties begin with circle time introductions and then we begin reading in pairs (1 child to 1 adult) or small groups. During the Reading Party, the children receive a snack, a new book of their choice, and a new pair of pajamas. The age range of the children is from 4-12 years old. Reading Parties last about an hour and run throughout the year during from Tuesday-Friday at 11 am - 12 pm. How to Apply: You must fill out our volunteer application and sign up for your background check. Please email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to receive the appropriate links. Please know that ALL volunteers must pass the background check and fill out the volunteer application to be able to attend the Reading Parties. All personal information will be kept confidential. Please check out Pajama Program's website or email Najamah at najamah@pajamaprogram.org to learn more about volunteer opportunities. Thank you for your interest! http://pajamaprogram.org/
10016.title: Make a Child Smile through Reading at our NYC Reading Center!

10016.description: English in Action (EiA) and Andrew Romay New Immigrant Center (ARNIC), programs of the English-Speaking Union of the United States, match non-native speakers with American volunteers for one-to-one conversation practice. EiA and ARNIC are always looking for friendly new tutors. As an EiA/ARNIC Volunteer you will make a difference in your community, meet new people, share your culture and experiences, and learn about other cultures. Volunteers need no formal training, just an interest in other languages and cultures and the willingness to befriend a newcomer. Time commitment: minimum 2 hours per week. Volunteer leadership positions available. English in Action may mean the beginning of a lifelong interest in a particular area of the world, or even a deeper understanding of one's own culture.
10016.title: English Conversation Tutors needed!
10016.org: The English-Speaking Union of the United States

10016.description: Individuals interested in working in a large municipal hospital, where they will assist patients of various age ranges and ethnicities. Ability to answer telephone phones, data entry, explain medical services, follow-up and/or remind patients about their medical appointments and work with charts and files. Volunteers are needed during the day and evening hours.
10016.title: Administrative Assistant

10016.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
10016.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate New York City NY

10016.description: Volunteers are needed who have good communication skills, can work well with people, who have computer skills, have telephone skills. Volunteer should be able to file documents. Volunteers are need in the administrative offices and clinics. Bi-lingual skills helpful, but not required. Volunteers are needed day, evening and on weekends.
10016.title: Clerical

10016.description: Assist the Director of Volunteer Services create a volunteer newsletter. The newsletter will highlight volunteers, volunteer opportunities, etc. Some volunteerism will take on-site. However, some aspects of the position can take place off-site. Volunteer hours are flexible. Volunteer should have good writing skills, ability to communicate with a variety of individuals. (volunteers and staff) Vounteer should be computer literate.
10016.title: Writer

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to visit hospitalized patients on various floors of the hospital. Volunteers will work with people of all ages, ethnicities, and religion. Volunteers should enjoy working with people, as they will interact with the clinical and support services staff within the hospital. Volunteers may read to patients, write letters, escort a patient, play board games, communicate with nursing or social work on behalf of the patient. Volunteers can be utilized Monday-Sunday. Bi-Lingual skills are helpful, but not required
10016.title: Volunteer Friendly Visitors

10016.description: Do you have a curiosity about global affairs? Lead a U.S. foreign policy discussion group today! For over 55 years, the Foreign Policy Association's Great Decisions program has brought together people and communities to encourage individuals to engage in the world around them and to think critically about the global issues facing policymakers. Each year, FPA produces the Great Decisions briefing book, examining eight U.S. foreign policy and global affairs topics. All across the U.S., discussion groups meet to consider and discuss these topics, constituting the largest civil-education network in the country. Discussion group leaders organize and lead these meetings in their communities. Become a group leader now!
10016.title: Lead a global affairs discussion group today!!

10016.description: For over 28 years, the Volunteer Referral Center has helped thousands of New Yorkers find great volunteer opportunities. Through personal, one-on-one interviews, we can match your interests, skills, and availability with a non-profit that needs your help. We work with over 275 non-profits in NYC. Best of all, our services are always FREE! Call for your interview appointment: (212) 889-4805 or sign-up at: http://volunteer-referral.com/ready-to-volunteer-in-nyc-lets-go/
10016.title: Want to Volunteer in NYC? We Can Help You Find the Perfect Volunteer Job!

10016.description: Assist the Department of Volunteer Services in creating a newsletter. Help design a logo and cover for the newsletter. Assist in writing articles for the newsletter and interviewing volunteers and/or staff for the newsletter. This assignment is flexible in terms of time. The volunteer can work on some of the assignments off site, but must be available to meet to compile the newsletter prior to printing. Art background helpful.
10016.title: Volunteer Newsletter

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to assist patients in the Patient Library with information regarding the books housed in the library. Volunteers will visit patients on the in-patients floors with the book cart and offer books, magazines and newspapers to the patients. Volunteers will assist with book sales, shelving of books and work at the information desk. Volunteers will assist in providing books to the some of the outpatient clinics via the book cart, and assist the outpatient in selecting a book or magazine.
10016.title: Patient Library

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to work in a variety of departments within the hospital. Clerical and customer services assistance is needed in our ambulatory care(clinics), Admitting Servcies and Rehab Medicine to name a few. Volunteers will assist with telephone calls, scheduling appointments, greeting patients, providing directions, assisting with data entry. Volunteers will work with the clinical and support services staff of the hospital. Volunteers who are bi-lingual will assist patients whose first language is not English. The volunteer is needed at least 3 days per week for at least 3 hours per day.
10016.title: Clerical/Customer Services Assistant

10016.description: Volunteers are needed to visit patients who do not have visitors and or family. Also, read to a patient, play cards or chess, write a letter, obtain books from the Patient Library or just sit and talks with the patient(s). Volunteer who speak languages other than English are capable of using their language skills by interpreting for the patient.
10016.title: Volunteer Friendly Visitors Program

10016.description: MAKE A DIFFERENCE! VOLUNTEER! Want to Volunteer? Need help getting started? Come in for a free and personal one-on-one interview to help find the right match for you! The Volunteer Referral Center has opportunities at over 300 non-profit agencies in New York City, ranging from social services organizations, advocacy work, and children's agencies to theater groups and museums. VRC has been serving the NYC community for 28 years and is a great place to learn about a wide range of volunteer needs. Call 212-889-4805 for an interview or sign up online at http://volunteer-referral.com/ready-to-volunteer-in-nyc-lets-go/. (Note: Interviews are free of charge and by appointment only.)
10016.title: Volunteer Referral Service

10033.description: Our program depends on a lot of volunteer labor for many jobs and tasks. Our population is diverse and many of the parents of our students speak only Spanish. We need a point person to co-ordinate all of the volunteers, motivate them and train them and make sure all jobs are covered each week. This person should be outgoing and friendly, very organized, and needs to be bilingual Spanish/English. A major part of our mission is community building, and this is a crucial role for accomplishing that. We want all parents and other volunteers to feel like a part of the team and important to our organization's work in the community.
10033.title: Volunteer Coordinator

10014.description: Hope & Heroes (www.hopeandheroes.org) supports the patients, families, and doctors in the Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology & Stem Cell Transplantation at Columbia University Medical Center. On Sunday, May 21st, we will be having our 8th Annual Walk at Pier 84 (44th St at Hudson River/West Side Highway). We are looking for volunteers to do everything from registration, food/beverage, greeting, cheering, and much more. We will need people from 7AM until 2PM. We would love to have you whether you can stay the full time or just come for a shift. We welcome individuals, families, co-workers, youth groups, school groups, etc. To learn more about the walk please go to www.hopeandheroeswalk.org. Thanks and we look forward to having you join us!
10014.title: Help Children with Cancer- Volunteer for the Hope & Heroes Walk

10014.description: Hope & Heroes (www.hopeandheroes.org) supports the patients, families, and doctors in the Division of Pediatric Hematology, Oncology & Stem Cell Transplantation at Columbia University Medical Center. 10014.description: On Sunday, May 21, 2017, the Children’s Museum of the Arts (CMA) will host its second annual CMA Kids Fair from 11AM to 4PM, located on Charlton Street, between Hudson and Greenwich streets. The free public event will comprise of curated local artisanal child and family-oriented vendors that focus on delivering unique and high-quality specialty goods. In addition, the event will feature collaborative art projects and outdoor games. Through this event, we hope to bring together the surrounding residential and business communities of NYC in a fun and creative public event designed specifically for families. Volunteers will be assisting our CMA Teaching Artists to facilitate art-making workshops and activities for children and families. Volunteers will also oversee the Herman Miller Spun Chairs and recreational games, and will aid in the general operations of the outdoor event (including breakdown). As a gesture of gratitude, each volunteer will receive two Family Passes for general admission to CMA at a future date and an official volunteer acknowledgement letter for their efforts. Volunteers will also be provided name tags, snacks, and beverages on the event date.
10014.title: CMA Kids Fair Volunteer

10014.description: We are looking for Volunteers to march with us down 5th Ave. for Pride March this summer! You will recieve a Love Yourself T-shirt, stickers and a button. March with us!!
10014.title: Pride March

10014.description: JOIN HUDSON RIVER PARK’S HRPGreenTeam Gain meaningful experience working with like-minded individuals looking to beautify and maintain Hudson River Park’s picturesque waterside landscape! This volunteer program is an exciting opportunity for community members to nurture their inner green thumb alongside their neighbors while improving public green space. Members of the HRPGreenTeam will work with our seasoned horticulture staff and participate in landscape enhancement activities including planting, weeding, pruning, mulching, trimming of ornamental grasses, addition of soil amendments, cleaning of vegetation beds, and other general gardening tasks. When: One Saturday of every month from March-October; 10AM-1PM March 25th April 15th May6th June 3rd June 17th July 15th July 29th August 12th August 26th September 9th October 21st November 18th What we provide: Safety and horticulture training, tools and equipment, Hudson River Park Volunteer T-Shirt, water, snacks, FUN! Can’t commit to all of our events? No problem! RSVP to any or all of the Green Team volunteer days. Locations and activities will vary each month, and volunteers will get to experience the Park from a whole new perspective throughout the seasons. Space is limited, so RSVP today to volunteer@fohrp.org or call for more information (347-515-2242)
10014.title: HRP GreenTeam at Hudson River Park!

10014.description: Participants of the Compost Ambassador Program are the public face of our Compost Drop-off sites located throughout Hudson River Park. Compost Ambassadors help to educate the public and raise awareness of our 2017 compost initiatives, providing helpful information about how Park patrons can get involved and further benefit their local community.
10014.title: Compost Ambassador

10014.description: This opportunity is available daily from 9:10 PM-9:40 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week, the same evert every week. Training is provided. Help rescue healthy roasted vegetables and protein that would have been thrown away and bring it to a nearby homeless shelter to feet those who need it the most! This opportunity is available in both Midtown East and the Village. Heavyweight: the average amount of food is a total of 60 1bs
10014.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 9:10PM-9:40PM Food Rescue Events!

10014.description: Hudson River Park’s Neighborhood Gardener Volunteers are instrumental to the Park community, contributing vital support, time, and efforts to maintain our 4-mile footprint. Neighborhood Gardener Volunteers work alongside trained horticulture staff on weekdays to cultivate their green thumbs through fun tasks such as planting, pruning, weeding, mulching and more while learning about the flora and fauna of the West Side’s \"backyard.\" With the Hudson River and the impressive cityscape as a backdrop, volunteers gain an immersive experience into the Park’s history, goals, and beautification and preservation efforts. Opportunities are available weekday mornings (9:00-12:00) from April through November, and regular orientations and trainings are held to provide a comprehensive overview of our organization, build skills and techniques, and train new volunteers to the program. No experience is necessary- everyone from beginners to garden enthusiasts are welcome!
10014.title: Volunteer Neighborhood Gardener

10014.description: No Walkathon is currently scheduled and we seek someone with skill and interest to do substantial leadership work in organizing one. IMPORTANT: For most activities, we require at least a year of experience - and several years for some activities. Except for those with high level, professional skills, we ask most volunteers to average at least 15 hours a week. Some exceptions to these guidelines are possible. You can speak with us about this before you come in. If possible, please include your resume.
10014.title: The End Poverty Walkathon

10121.description: This opportunity is available every Sunday-Friday from 9 PM-9:30 PM! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and feeding the hungry. We are currently looking for Lead Rescuers to join our leadership team. A Lead Rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue leftover food that would otherwise have been thrown away and bring it to those who need it the most! You will pick up food donations from multiple vendors in a popular Midtown food court and deliver it on-foot to a nearby homeless shelter. Mediumweight: the average amount of food is a total of 30 lbs.
10121.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for 9PM-9:30PM Food Rescue Events!

10121.description: This opportunity is available every Saturday and Sunday! Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is a nonprofit food rescue organization dedicated to reducing food waste and getting food to those in need. We are currently looking to bring on Lead Rescuers to our leadership team. A lead rescuer is a passionate and dedicated volunteer who commits to leading one event, once per week. Training is provided. Help rescue bread, pastries, and other delicious food that would otherwise have been thrown out and help feed the hungry of NYC! You will pick up leftover food from two food vendors in a popular Midtown food court and deliver it to a nearby homeless shelter. This event lasts just 20 minutes, and will end at Antonio Olivieri Drop-In Center. Mediumweight: the average amount of food is a total of 30 lbs.
10121.title: Weekly Volunteer Needed for Weekend Midtown Food Rescue Events 9PM-9:30PM!
